job_data.title: Principal AI Engineer – Edge AI Face Recognition
job_data.description:
At a glance…

Position: Principal AI Engineer (Edge AI Face Recognition)

Location / Work Type: Anywhere / Fully remote

Technical Hands-On: Yes

Leadership: Yes

Company Location: HQ in US and Australia

About the Company

Xailient’s breakthrough technology dramatically reduces the costs of using Computer Vision AI in real-world applications. By reducing costs, we are accelerating the next wave of technology, bringing AI to the Edge for smart sensors and devices.

We are on our way to installing our edge software on 50 billion devices and we need your help!

Xailient is a revenue-producing, VC-funded start-up.

The Role in General

Xailient works with innovators and early adopter customers in the Edge computing space. We are seeking a Principal AI Engineer. This is a new role, and we expect you to put your own imprint on it.

This is a technical leadership role in a small, growing company, and with a requirement for significant hands-on development involvement. Leadership responsibilities will span from day-to-day technical management to macro-scale technology and team strategy. The right candidate will be ready (eager) to roll up your sleeves.

As a Principal AI Engineer you will play a critical role in the development of computer vision AI solutions for deployment at the edge of Internet-of-things (IOT) networks. The Principal will lead in defining and driving solution development for a range of AI problems and guiding the business as a technical subject matter expert.

This is an AI Engineering role, not an AI Science role. You and the team will be responsible for producing a diversity of AI models addressing an array of customers’ practical needs. This will entail trade-offs between generalizability, accuracy, memory, speed, and other performance characteristics. You’ll be working with product and customer timelines and quality criteria. Welcome to the leading edge of AI!

We embrace diversity. Part-time or full-time candidates will be considered. We welcome candidates with family/life commitments and part-time availability, but “full-time professional passion”.

This role is remote, and you are free to work from anywhere. The team is global and therefore early / late calls one or two times a week are common, for coordination / collaboration.

Candidates residing in Australia are required to have Australian citizenship, Permanent Residence or other long-term visa rights to work in Australia, and a nationality compatible with ADF procurement requirements.

Note: The start date for this position is ASAP.

Everyone’s time is valuable so please help by only applying if you meet the Mandatory Requirements for this role - thank you.

Mandatory Requirements

● 7+ years of experience with Edge AI and Face Recognition

● Development and deployment of Face Recognition solutions in commercial setting.

● Experience developing custom deep learning computer vision AI solutions focused on face recognition and object detection.

● Experience deploying deep learning models for embedded devices / IoT edge devices, down to the chip level

● Demonstrated ability to go deep technically on AI methodologies that are best suited to specific business and customer problems, as well as elevate your thinking to consider business and strategic implications.

● Proven track record in developing AI solutions from 'concept to deployment'

● Experience with the MLOps processes, including lifecycle management and automation

● Degree-qualified in AI / Machine Learning / Computer Science or equivalent experience.

● Ability to work independently

● Experience mentoring, guiding, and leading other AI engineers

Responsibilities

● Lead research and development efforts on Face Recognition systems for Edge AI Devices.

● Monitor existing Face Recognition AI product performance and provide subject matter expert for further development / improvement.

● Stay current on the latest cloud / edge AI/ML technologies, trends, and methodologies.

● Lead research effort to explore the latest cloud / edge AI models and methodologies that can be applied on existing or new edge AI product development.

● Provide subject matter expert input on business engagements and product road maps

● Design and develop robust AI solutions using commercial and custom deep learning AI tools.

● Review and approval of work performed by others

● Capability development across AI-related aspects of Xailient business/engineering/operations

Technical Skills / Experience

● Strong fundamental understanding on how face recognition and object detection is trained. The candidate must have experience in modifying model architecture, backbone and loss function to solve problems, e.g. speed, size, accuracy. Simply using an open-source model as-is would not be sufficient.

● Keeping abreast of the AI landscape and the latest academic papers and determining how we can apply leading edge concepts into our solutions

● Strong technical analytic skills in troubleshooting and experimentation to understand why a model behaviour and formulate fixes for any undesirable behaviour / performance.

● The ability to select an appropriate technical solution, utilizing benchmark data, and establishing sound tradeoff decisions regarding model behaviour and performance.

● Proficient with multiple deep learning frameworks such as TensorFLow, Keras and PyTorch

● Proficient in Python, C++ is highly regarded.

● Demonstrated ability to articulate Al-specific challenges and identify gaps.

● Excellent communication, written and verbal skills, to articulate challenging technical concepts to both lay and expert audiences

● Strong fundamentals in mathematics, computer science, information theory, probability, especially linear algebra

● Experience with AWS highly regarded

Non-Technical Attributes

● Customer Focus - Desire to deliver products that delight

● Communication - Explain technical topics to lay audiences

● Team Builder - We’re growing!

● Dependability - Deliver on promises, provide status proactively

● Initiative - see a problem, solve a problem

● Care for Quality - Care about your work and take pride in doing a good job

● Flexibility - Excited to learn new things and work outside of the comfort zone, comfortable with changing priorities of a startup environment

● Collaboration - Good ideas come from anywhere, great ideas come from collaboration

● Creative Problem Solver - turn abstract or vague ideas into actionable objectives

● Teamwork - No brilliant jerks, but weirdos welcome

job_data.title: Senior UI/UX Designer – Minimalist & User-Centric Focus (Remote)
job_data.description:
We’re looking for a talented Senior Web & App Designer who is obsessed with creating easy and approachable customer experiences. If you’re a perfectionist with a passion for intuitive, minimalistic and cohesive design, a deep appreciation for Apple’s design philosophy, and an eye for every pixel, we want you on our team.

Who You Are:
• User-Centric Problem Solver: You design with the user’s perspective at the forefront, not the designer’s ego or the business’s agenda. Your goal is to create experiences that are intuitive, anxiety-free and so simple they require no manual. Every interaction you design feels natural, seamless and welcoming.
• Practical and Purpose-Driven: You understand design isn’t about being artistic or “original” for its own sake. It’s about solving problems and making users happy. Your designs are minimalistic, approachable and sophisticated, with just the right touch of fun to keep them engaging without being overwhelming.
• Craftsman of Simplicity: You strip away friction and complexity, focusing on ease of use, elegance and cohesion. Your work blends function and form, ensuring every element serves a clear purpose and contributes to a delightful, stress-free user experience.

Who We Are:

At Galileo FX, we’re living proof that great companies can start from nothing. Our team is made up of innovators and visionaries, including people who left corporate giants like Google and Microsoft to build something extraordinary with us. Founded in Italy with no outside funding, we reinvested every dollar to double our sales year over year for the past four years. Today, we’re a financially healthy, fast-growing startup with offices in Italy, Tokyo, and New York. And a flagship product that has already empowered over 10,000 users worldwide, mostly in the United States.

But this is just the beginning. With a track record of success and ambitious plans to expand into new markets, we’re building more groundbreaking products that will reshape industries.

Your Responsibilities:
• Design consistent, high-quality interfaces across mobile apps, web apps, websites, and emails that reflect our core design philosophy: Intuitive, Minimalistic, and Cohesive.
• Leverage your understanding of white space, contrast, proportions, and tasteful aesthetics to create stunning and user-friendly designs.
• Use Figma flawlessly to develop designs that our development team can implement with precision.
• Rapidly iterate and refine designs based on feedback, maintaining energy and focus until perfection is achieved.
• Create designs that prioritize simplicity, meaningful details, and an exceptional user experience.
• Collaborate with our dev team to ensure your Figma designs are implemented perfectly.
• Adhere to and enhance branding guidelines with extreme precision to maintain consistency across platforms.

What We’re Looking For:
• A minimalist designer with naturally good taste who understands the subjectivity of design decisions.
• Someone who values simplicity as the ultimate sophistication and pays attention to both details and the big picture.
• A fan of Apple’s design philosophy who uses thoughtful animations, icons and interactions to enhance usability.
• A natural communicator who thrives in a collaborative environment and can deliver under tight timelines.
• Someone better than us at what we do, ready to elevate our design standards to the next level.

What You Don’t Need:
• Coding skills—our dev team handles implementation. Your job is to create pixel-perfect designs, and we’ll handle the rest.

Why Work With Us:
• Lead the evolution of our design approach, shaping it to be more intuitive, minimalistic, and cohesive.
• Join a team that views design as a critical element of success.
• Enjoy the flexibility of working fully remotely with a supportive and passionate team.

job_data.title: UX/UI Designer – Digital Experience in Retail Environments
job_data.description:
BIP US is a team of over 4,500 consulting professionals across 13 countries. We are Europe’s fastest growing digital consulting company and are on track to reach the Top 20 by 2025. Operating at the intersection of business and technology, we design, develop, and deliver sustainable solutions rapidly and at scale, creating greater value for our client’s customers, employees, and other stakeholders.

BIP US is seeking to grow its US consulting team and is looking for a UX/UI Designer with 3 to 5 years of professional experience designing digital activations for physical environments to join our East Coast consulting team.

You must have valid US work authorization and must physically reside in the Raleigh area, within a 50-mile commute. We are unable to support relocation costs.

Please do not apply for this position unless you meet the criteria outlined above.

Specific Opportunity:

This consultant will be a part of our dynamic team and play a key role in crafting innovative digital experiences and compelling product storytelling across physical environments. In collaboration with the product design team of a leading global tech company, this role will design seamless digital activations that enhance retail experiences and influence consumer interactions across multiple touchpoints. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of retail by creating transformative solutions with a focus on cultural sensitivity and sustainability, while working on projects that will reach global audiences. The consultant’s work will blend cutting-edge design with strategic thinking to create impactful, user-centered solutions in diverse markets worldwide.

What You Will Be Doing:
• Experience Design: Lead the creation of seamless digital activations for physical environments, enhancing storytelling across touchpoints to ensure a consistent and engaging user experience in retail spaces.
• Cultural Sensitivity: Design solutions that resonate globally, considering regional preferences, behaviors, and sustainability to ensure cultural relevance across markets in Asia, Europe, MEA, and the U.S.
• Collaboration: Work closely with the Europe-based design team and global developers, collaborating with cross-functional teams to bring designs to life and ensure seamless execution.
• Impactful Solutions: Develop designs to be deployed across global retailers, influencing how digital content and interactions are experienced in physical spaces and driving innovation in retail.
• Innovation and Strategy: Stay ahead of trends by integrating new tools and technologies into your design process, solving complex challenges with a creative and strategic approach.
• User-Centered Design: Prioritize the end user in all designs, using feedback and data to refine and optimize digital activations for maximum engagement and performance.

Requirements:
• Proved Education & Experience: Bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years in UX/UI design, with a focus on digital activations for physical environments (e.g., retail, showrooms). Global market experience is a plus.
• Passion for Innovation: Strong drive to create user-centered, visually compelling designs that push boundaries and enhance brand impact.
• Storytelling & Design Skills: Proven ability to craft narrative-driven designs that effectively communicate brand messages and engage users. Strong portfolio required.
• Collaboration & Communication: Excellent at working with multidisciplinary, global teams, ensuring clear communication and alignment of design vision.
• Cultural Sensitivity: Understanding of cultural nuances in design with experience creating solutions for diverse global audiences.
• Design Tools Proficiency: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, and prototyping tools. Familiarity with design systems and project management platforms is a plus.
• Problem-Solving & Adaptability: Creative, solution-oriented, and able to iterate on designs based on feedback and evolving business needs.
• *The base salary range for this role is $60,000-$90,000**

Benefits:
• Choice of medical, dental, vision insurance.
• Voluntary benefits.
• Short- and long-term disability.
• HSA and FSAs.
• Matching 401k.
• Discretionary performance bonus.
• Employee referral bonus.
• Employee assistance program.
• 9 public holidays.
• 22 days PTO.
• PTO buy and sell program.
• Volunteer days.
• Paid parental leave.
• Remote work environment with ability to travel to office as needed.

For more information about BIP US, visit https://www.bip-group.com/en-us/.

It is BIP US Consulting policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship, or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

BIP US provides a reasonable range of compensation for our roles. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, education, level of experience, and knowledge.

job_data.title: UI/UX Designer for Digital Wedding Invitation Platform
job_data.description:
We are looking for a talented UI/UX designer to create an intuitive and visually appealing design for our digital wedding invitation platform. Our platform will allow users to select from a variety of invitation templates, customize them, and share or download their invitations seamlessly.

If you’re a creative designer with experience in user-centric design and a keen eye for detail, we’d love to work with you!

Responsibilities:

Design wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for key platform screens:

Homepage

Template Gallery

Customization Tool

Download/Share Page

Ensure responsive and mobile-friendly designs.

Collaborate with developers to ensure seamless design-to-code implementation.

Incorporate feedback and iterate designs to enhance user experience.

Create a consistent and elegant visual theme aligning with wedding aesthetics.

Requirements:

Proven experience in UI/UX design for web platforms.

Proficiency in design tools like Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, or similar.

Experience designing for responsive web and mobile platforms.

A strong portfolio showcasing previous UI/UX projects (bonus for event-related or e-commerce platforms).

Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Familiarity with user-centered design principles.

Preferred Skills:

Experience with wedding/event design themes.

Ability to create interactive prototypes for user testing.

Understanding of accessibility standards.

Deliverables:

Wireframes for the entire platform.

High-fidelity mockups for all key screens.

Clickable prototype for user flow testing.

Sample suggestions will be provided in DM

job_data.title: SaaS UX/UI Designer (FULLY REMOTE)
job_data.description:
Who we are:

WhatConverts is a dynamic and scaling marketing software company that empowers agencies and businesses to prove and grow their marketing ROI. We provide a comprehensive lead tracking solution for marketers - one place to track all leads.

Summary:

As we continue to expand, we're on the hunt for a top-performing SaaS UX/UI Designer who will be a key player in taking WhatConverts from 20,000 customers to 200,000 and beyond! Your expertise will help shape the future of our platform and ensure our solutions are engaging and user-friendly.

In this role, you'll work closely with marketers, developers, and other stakeholders to design and enhance our SaaS products. We're seeking someone who is passionate about creating intuitive and engaging user experiences, with a solid understanding of user-centered design principles and a proven track record of designing interfaces that enhance both customer satisfaction and company growth.

What you'll do:
• Lead the UX/UI design process for our SaaS products, from conceptualization to final implementation
• Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to refine and improve designs
• Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
• Shape company strategy by transforming analyses into actionable design prototypes
• Develop solutions that are visually appealing and align with our design system
• Stay up-to-date with UX design trends and digital marketing practices
• Manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines

Other duties as assigned; job duties will likely expand based upon aptitude and ability

Skills and qualifications:
• 3+ years of experience as a UX/UI Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing successful digital products
• Proficiency with prototype tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD
• Understanding of Atomic Design and Design Systems
• Proven ability to implement and update products and features, balancing business and customer needs
• Experience with UX research and a customer-focused approach
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Company benefits/perks:
• Remote first company - we believe in breaking down barriers of bureaucracy and empowering our remote team members to work agilely to accomplish more in a shorter amount of time
• Immediate impact - the moment you join our team we hand you the reins to work on projects independently and make a direct impact
• Health/Wellness - we offer three tiers of premium medical insurance, vision insurance, and dental insurance - with WhatConverts covering 100% of the premium for individual plans! WhatConverts also offers LTD/STD/Life insurance that is 100% paid by the company
• Employee support - we provide an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) that offers counseling, legal, debt management, and travel assistance services free of cost to our employees
• Time off - in addition to paid holidays, WhatConverts offers both flexible time off and competitive PTO plans that continue to offer greater rewards to long-term employees
• Diversity and inclusion - our workplace is positive, supportive, and inclusive and we ask all new hires to bring that same approach

Before you apply, you should:
• Learn about (http://www.whatconverts.com/) our team
• Read about what makes us different (https://www.whatconverts.com/careers) or watch a product overview (https://www.whatconverts.com/watch-a-demo)
• Read our reviews on G2 (https://www.g2.com/products/whatconverts/reviews)

WhatConverts is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, hire, pay, and promote without regard to gender, race, sexual orientation, age, religion, veteran status, physical/mental abilities, or any other identities protected by law.

job_data.title: Senior UI/UX Designer, Wordscapes Solitaire
job_data.description:
PeopleFun is an award-winning creator of mobile games for players across the globe. We are part of AppLovin, a publicly traded company, with world-class projects, resources, and infrastructure. PeopleFun is a Dallas-based game studio founded and led by game industry veterans, where game developers thrive on collaboration, creativity, teamwork, and fun. Our games are played by over 25 million players each month, and we have a number of exciting mobile games in development to fuel the future growth of PeopleFun.

We believe in bringing People together through Fun by creating the best in class social features and communities in our games that enables our players to engage deeply with other players. Secondly we endeavor to bring our studio teammates together by creating the very best game teams that foster healthy collaboration, incredible productivity, and life-long professional relationships.

Candidates who reside or will reside in the following locations are eligible for this role: California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, Oregon, Rhode Island, Texas, and Washington State.

Job Summary

PeopleFun is looking for a Sr. UI/UX Designer to create and evolve the user interface designs in our new Wordscapes Solitaire game. Qualified candidates will possess a solid track record of shipping industry leading titles, utilizing strong graphic design sensibilities, vivid use of color, and intuitive UX fundamentals to generate best-in-genre assets.

Responsiblities
• Create and interpret ideas into rough concepts that can become fully realized in proprietary tool sets, creating easy to navigate, captivating gameplay sequences, and rewarding moments for our players.
• End-to-end user experience design, owning the overall user experience, service flows and consistency across an entire product.
• Create wireframes, prototypes, and user flows using industry standard software.
• Collaborate cross-functionally from initial concept to release.
• Design and Implement complex flows, screens, and components at a high-quality bar working closely with the directors.
• Support leads and directors with accurate scoping and estimation of your work.
• Innovate and push the boundaries of UI visuals, bringing in fresh ideas and creative solutions for the product.
• Natural affinity towards 2D UI Artwork, motion graphics, and UI Animation for mobile games.

Requirements
• 5+ years professional experience as an UI artist developing games while possessing a UX/UI portfolio showcasing prior work & insight into your process.
• Prior experience shipping, mobile games (casual genre preferred).
• Demonstrated technical excellence with the ability to creatively solve problems and push a design forward.
• Expertise of Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, and additionals), Figma, and other visual creation tools.
• Knowledgeable in design fundamentals (layout, composition, grids, typography, color), and current mobile UX/UI design trends with experience integrating new concepts into designs.
• Demonstrated experience working with other artists, designers, and programmers.
• Initiative to create and maintain a vision for the UI Theme in a game, understanding that creating memorable game experiences is a team effort.
• A passionate, performance-driven self-starter with the flexibility to adapt to the evolving need of a live product.
• Active learner and seeker of self growth with the ability to see features through to completion and rapidly modify designs as information evolves.
• Interest in player behavior and experience, with a solid understanding of usability, UX, UI, and interactive design.

Preferred Qualifications
• Mastery and deep understanding of mobile game development.
• Experience creating ‘Creatives’ (ads) and Motion Graphics for media.
• Strong understanding of how to make cross-disciplinary tradeoffs between game design, art, and engineering.
• Extensive Unity knowledge including prefab setup, asset integration, and platform scaling.
• Ability to work with internal and external artists, as well as outsource companies.

PeopleFun provides a competitive total compensation package with a pay for performance rewards approach. The expected base pay range for this [CA based or North America based] position is $90,000-$130,000. Base compensation at PeopleFun is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Depending on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical and other benefits.

Benefits

Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance

Performance Bonuses

401K Match Policy

Flexible PTO Policy

Wellness Stipend

Free Lunch each Friday

Generous Parental Leave & Family-Friendly Culture

Annual Credits for Professional Development & In-App Purchases

PeopleFun is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about EEO rights as an applicant here .

job_data.title: Technical UI/UX Designer
job_data.description:
Summary:

We are a pioneering AI company focused on advancing core AI capabilities and applying them in real-world products. Our technologies have the potential to reshape industries and open new market opportunities. Our mission is to expand AI's role and create tools that enhance human potential and productivity.

We are seeking a talented Technical UI/UX Designer to join our team and play a key role in shaping the user experience for our cutting-edge AI products. In this role, you’ll design intuitive and visually compelling interfaces that bring complex AI technologies to life for diverse users. By collaborating closely with product and engineering teams, you’ll ensure our solutions are not only powerful but also accessible and impactful. Your expertise in both design and technical implementation will help bridge the gap between advanced AI capabilities and meaningful experiences, adding immense value to our products.

Job Requirements & Duties:
• Minimum 2-3 years of experience in UI/UX design, with a willingness to demonstrate a portfolio that showcases relevant work and design approach.
• Create prototypes, wireframes, and high-fidelity designs for AI applications.
• Collaborate with product, AI/ML Engineers, and developers to convert requirements into user-focused designs.
• Conduct user research and usability testing to understand user needs within AI contexts.
• Design data visuals and interactions to simplify complex AI outputs.
• Use front-end skills (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) or work with developers for accurate design implementation.
• Maintain design systems, standards, and accessibility across products.
• Stay updated on UI/UX and AI trends to bring innovative ideas to our team.
• Integrate feedback to continuously improve UI/UX for better usability.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

job_data.title: UX/UI Designer
job_data.description:
Employment Opportunity: UX/UI Specialist

We're Forward Creative – a team of passionate changemakers and innovators who believe in the power of creativity, diversity and collaboration. Rooted in the vibrant community of Atlantic Canada, we're a digital agency, delivering solutions for businesses and organizations to overcome challenges, unlock potential, and achieve lasting success.

If you're a bold, passionate individual who thrives on solving problems, craves innovation, and is committed to building a brighter future for our communities, then you belong at Forward Creative.

We're looking for the trailblazers, the visionaries, and the doers who are driven to make a real difference in the world.

We are seeking an experienced UX/UI Specialist to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will create seamless, engaging user experiences across web and mobile platforms, leveraging your design skills to bring websites to life and deliver impactful results for our clients. You will play a crucial role in ensuring our projects are aligned with modern industry standards, from both written and visual perspectives.

Key Responsibilities:
• User Experience & Interface Design: Craft visually appealing and user-centered designs, ensuring intuitive navigation, responsive design, and accessibility standards are met. Develop wireframes, prototypes, and final user interface designs that align with client goals.
• Collaboration & Project Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, content creators, and project managers, to ensure design consistency and best practices. Participate actively in brainstorming sessions and contribute to creative project development.
• Content & Visual Consistency: Bring expertise in both written content and visual elements, ensuring cohesive storytelling and consistency across platforms. Design graphics and visual assets using Figma, Canva, or similar tools, working closely with the Project Manager.
• User Research & Testing: Conduct user research, analyze findings, and use insights to inform design decisions. Develop user personas, conduct usability testing, and iterate on designs to improve user satisfaction and engagement.
• Industry Awareness & Innovation: Stay up-to-date with UX/UI best practices, emerging trends, and design tools to bring fresh ideas to the table. Contribute to workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions to inspire the team.

Your Skills & Experience:
• Proven experience as a UX/UI Specialist with a strong portfolio showcasing successful projects.
• Bachelor's degree in UX Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Graphic Design, or related field.
• Expertise in Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar design tools.
• In-depth understanding of user-centered design principles, responsive design, accessibility standards, and industry best practices.
• Strong visual design skills combined with an ability to create compelling written content that enhances user experience.
• Experience in working within an agile environment and managing multiple projects simultaneously.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate design choices and collaborate effectively with team members and clients.
• Passion for community engagement and making a positive impact on Atlantic Canada.

We are a growing team with opportunity for growth. Be part of a Collaborative & Supportive Environment.

Work Arrangement: Fully Remote Work.

Join Forward Creative Today!

Apply here:

https://forms.monday.com/forms/e090e061712c50d3322c52d76b264709?r=use1

We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible application process for all candidates. If you require any accommodations to participate in our application process, please reach out to us at careers@forwardcreative.ca. We are here to assist you and ensure that you have the best possible experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00-$57,000.00 per year

Additional pay:
• Bonus pay
• Commission pay

Benefits:
• Flexible schedule
• Paid time off
• Work from home

Flexible language requirement:
• French not required

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Experience:
• UI: 3 years (required)
• Usability: 3 years (required)
• UX: 3 years (required)
• Visual design: 3 years (required)

Work Location: Remote

job_data.title: UI/UX Designer
job_data.description:
Who are we?

Trip Ninja is a global travel technology company specializing in complex travel. We develop technologies that increase profit margins for travel companies while providing travellers with savings. We believe that the ability to travel is a beautiful thing and are on a mission to make travel smarter and more accessible.

Who is the right candidate to join our team?

We are looking for applicants who are curious, committed, and want to help improve the travel experience at scale. We offer flexible work schedules, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive team.

As a UI/UX Designer you can expect to:

- Develop and maintain various design files: produce and test prototypes; modify and revise existing designs to meet changing customer preferences

- Develop designs to support company operations, including advertising and promotional materials for our various products

- Set design requirements based on internal teams and user research

- Present product design ideas to cross-functional teams and senior leadership

- Gather feedback from product users and make informed adjustments to products to satisfy consumer preferences

- Work closely with the Engineering and Product teams to suggest improvements for both products and processes

- Stay up-to-date on current industry trends and market conditions

Required Qualifications & Experience:

- 2+ years professional experience with previous roles in UI/UX design

- Strong proficiency with design programs (Figma, Sketch, Adobe)

- Proven experience in all phases of the design process including: user research, copywriting, wireframing, prototyping, visual design, interaction design, and usability testing

- Ability to effectively communicate and translate design concepts to cross-functional teams

Desired Qualifications & Experience:

- Ability to translate conceptual design requirements into practical product features

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills

- Hard working and excellent attention to detail

- Independently motivated

- Familiarity with the structural and technical constraints of front-end (ReactJS) development and how to accommodate these constraints in product designs

$80,000 - $85,000 a year

What we offer:

- Competitive compensation and benefits package

- 100% remote work

- RRSP matching

- 4 weeks vacation: taking vacation and personal time is a priority

- Work-from-home: at our core we are remote-first company; we also offer our team members the ability to work abroad for up to 2 months per year

- Flexible work schedule: we are happy to work with our team to accommodate schedules that work for everyone

- Parental leave: we offer leave for all parents and are happy to accommodate the needs of anyone on our team who has children

- Engaging work: we solve the hard problems of the travel industry and provide endless opportunities to innovate

- Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: we strive for a balanced team that values different viewpoints and life experiences and strive to maintain an equitable hiring process

- 10% time to allow for self-led learning and exploration of new skills

Location

Trip Ninja is based in Halifax, Canada and we will be prioritizing candidates in the following cities: Toronto, London, Ottawa, Vancouver, Winnipeg, and Calgary.

If this sounds like you, let's talk!

job_data.title: UX/UI Designer - Freelance
job_data.description:
About Twine

We're a thriving ecosystem of top-tier freelancers from around the world. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups, Twine is the go-to platform for mission-critical projects. With over half a million registered freelancers and a growing roster of 35,000+ companies, we've become the comprehensive solution for freelancing.

Our Mission

At Twine, we recognise that companies require a flexible approach to hiring expert freelancers for their most critical projects. Traditional freelance platforms often fall short when it comes to scalability and diversity. That's where we shine. Twine operates as a thriving global freelance network, with diverse experts across various fields, including marketing, engineering, and AI. Our core mission is to empower creators, whether they're businesses or individual freelancers, to thrive in their creative endeavours.

About the Role

A growing entertainment booking platform seeks a mid-level UX/UI designer for a week-long project to develop an engaging, user-friendly website. The platform connects event planners with musicians through detailed multimedia profiles, advanced search functionality, and secure payment processing. This is an opportunity to shape the digital presence of an innovative service in the event entertainment industry.

Responsibilities

• Design an intuitive and visually appealing interface for both musicians and event planners
• Create responsive layouts for musician profiles featuring multimedia content
• Develop user-friendly search and filtering systems based on multiple criteria
• Design an integrated chat interface for client-musician communication
• Implement secure payment gateway interfaces

Requirements

• Strong portfolio demonstrating experience with multimedia-rich websites
• Proficiency in modern design tools (Figma, Adobe XD, or similar)
• Experience designing search interfaces and filtering systems
• Knowledge of responsive design principles and mobile-first approach
• Understanding of user experience best practices
• Familiarity with payment gateway interfaces

job_data.title: Associate UI/UX Designer
job_data.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Canada

Who We Are

Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners.

About The Role

As an Associate Experience Designer (UI/UX) you will be involved in our design thinking process and the creation of innovative mobile, tablet and web products. You will bridge the gap between design, business, and technology to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands.

What You'll Do
• Work with design leads to create compelling interactive experiences
• Perform user research and develop information architecture, user goals, journey maps, and design wireframes and visual interfaces
• Collaborate with developers to ensure pixel perfect execution across all project deliverables
• Work with strategy consultants to gain insights into clients’ business and project objectives
• Learn the end-to-end process of project delivery and the associated design tools involved

Qualifications
• Firm grasp of design fundamentals demonstrated by a strong portfolio of digital projects
• Meticulous attention to detail and a keen eye for typography and visual hierarchy
• Clear and effective communication skills in articulating design concepts and rationales
• Proficient in Figma and an eagerness to learn new tools
• Positive attitude with a desire to grow within a collaborative, inspiring teamwork environment

Perks and Benefits
• Mentorship Program
• Socials, Outings & Retreats
• Culture of Learning & Development
• Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits Package
• New Device Allowance
• Retirement Planning
• Flexible Working Hours
• Work from Home Flexibility
• Service Recognition Programs

Bonus Points

Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have!

Konrad is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

job_data.title: Sr. UI/UX Designer
job_data.description:
Synacor is seeking an experienced and visionary Senior UI/UX Designer to define, design, and elevate the end-user experience of our email and collaboration application suite - Zimbra. This role combines strategic thinking, creativity, and technical expertise to craft seamless, visually engaging, and intuitive UI/UX experiences that directly impact over 100 million users worldwide. You will lead efforts to create best-in-class designs across multiple applications and projects, ensuring cohesive and engaging user interactions for internal and external stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities
• User-Centric Design: Craft simple, intuitive, and visually appealing user experiences by prioritizing user personas at the core of every design decision.
• UI Design Leadership: Develop visually compelling user interfaces, including layout designs, color schemes, typography, and interactive elements, ensuring adherence to modern UI standards and accessibility guidelines.
• Design Ownership: Lead the end-to-end design process, including information architecture (IA), user flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes, ensuring alignment with established style guides and design principles.
• Research and Validation: Partner with the team to identify research needs, conduct user interviews, map user journeys, and gather user feedback before, during, and after development to support a data-driven design approach.
• Design Systems Leadership: Build, maintain, and scale design systems, ensuring consistency across applications while driving the adoption of design guidelines, reusable components, and best practices.
• Prototyping and Interaction Design: Create interactive prototypes to communicate design ideas and explore new interaction patterns, ensuring a seamless blend of functionality and aesthetics.
• Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to align UI/UX goals with technical constraints and business objectives, fostering a collaborative and efficient development process.
• Accessibility Advocacy: Ensure designs meet accessibility standards, making products inclusive and usable for a diverse audience.

Minimum Qualifications
• Experience: 10+ years in user experience and user interface design, with a focus on enterprise applications, showcasing a proven ability to design at scale for end-user experiences.
• Education: Degree in fields related to Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Interaction Design, Visual Design, or equivalent experience in these areas.
• Tools: Expertise in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Miro, and prototyping tools like Axure or InVision.
• UI/UX Expertise: Demonstrated experience designing enterprise applications, with a portfolio showcasing a balance of user experience insights and strong visual design skills.
• Collaboration Track Record: Proven success working cross-functionally with globally distributed product and engineering teams to deliver enterprise-grade products in high-tech environments.
• Strong portfolio demonstrating the design process and artifacts, with a keen ability to balance user needs, business goals, and technical feasibility.

Preferred Qualifications
• Familiarity with creating or enhancing scalable design systems that support complex product ecosystems.
• Advanced knowledge of responsive and adaptive design principles, ensuring optimal experiences across devices.
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
• Experience implementing and advocating for WCAG and accessibility best practices in UI design.
• Self-starter with ability to define UI/UX priorities and drive their adoption

Why Join Us?
• Influence the experience of 100 million+ global users across enterprise platforms.
• Fully remote (Eastern Time)
• Be part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and a data-driven approach to design.
• Enjoy competitive compensation, professional growth opportunities, and a chance to make a real impact in the industry.

Please note, although the position is remote, applicants located in Canada, must be able to work out of Ontario.

job_data.title: Web Designer UI/UX
job_data.description:
Web Designer UI/UX

Reports to: CTO

Purpose

The web designer at CFI designs the layout and functionality of the company’s websites including designing and updating all pages and collaborating with the Product team as necessary to execute initiatives.

The web designer understands user experience and is able to design websites that are easy to understand, navigate, and use, and adhere to design standards and specifications.

Key indicators of success in this role are measured by website conversion metrics on key pages (e.g. purchases, account generation, etc.) and user behavior (e.g. heatmaps and analytics).

Job description
• Concept and design engaging and responsive web experiences
• Work with CFI’s marketing team on data-driven design decisions, with the ultimate goal of improving website conversion rate with A/B testing tools and analytics
• Assist with usability and website conversion optimization testing, defer to that data, and add or edit existing pages based on results
• Identify opportunities for reducing friction, increasing site performance and improving the user experience
• Facilitate design-to-engineering handoff and communicate desired functionality to CFI’s engineering team
• Craft engaging landing pages in platforms like WordPress or Instapage to support campaign objectives
• Contribute to the development, maintenance, and evolution of a Figma design system and component library
• Support other design initiatives ad-hoc design projects including presentations, graphics, ads, white papers, etc, as needed
• Serve as a design advocate for our team, keeping up to date on the latest UX research and design practices and bringing them to the team
• Collaborate with Product and Graphic Designers on cross-functional projects

Qualifications
• Two or more years of work experience in web design
• Mastery of web design tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
• Proven history of working with a cross-functional team to ship high-quality products
• Deep understanding of responsive web design principles
• Familiarity with web design optimization for accessibility
• Awareness of SEO, page speed and web analytics impact of changes
• Experience with WordPress or similar content management systems
• Knowledge of HTML and CSS, preferred

job_data.title: Senior UI/UX Designer – Minimalist
job_data.description:
Senior Web & App Designer

We are seeking a talented Senior Web & App Designer who is passionate about creating intuitive and approachable customer experiences.
About You
• User-Centric Problem Solver: You design with the user's perspective at the forefront, focusing on simplicity, elegance, and cohesion.
• Practical and Purpose-Driven: You understand design is about solving problems and making users happy, rather than being artistic or original for its own sake.
• Craftsman of Simplicity: You strip away friction and complexity, focusing on ease of use, elegance, and cohesion.
About Us

At Galileo FX, we're a fast-growing startup with offices in Italy, Tokyo, and New York. Our team is made up of innovators and visionaries who have built something extraordinary together.
Your Responsibilities
• Design consistent, high-quality interfaces across mobile apps, web apps, websites, and emails that reflect our core design philosophy: Intuitive, Minimalistic, and Cohesive.
• Leverage your understanding of white space, contrast, proportions, and tasteful aesthetics to create stunning and user-friendly designs.
• Use Figma flawlessly to develop designs that our development team can implement with precision.
• Rapidly iterate and refine designs based on feedback, maintaining energy and focus until perfection is achieved.
• Create designs that prioritize simplicity, meaningful details, and an exceptional user experience.
• Collaborate with our dev team to ensure your Figma designs are implemented perfectly.
• Adhere to and enhance branding guidelines with extreme precision to maintain consistency across platforms.
Requirements
• A minimalist designer with naturally good taste who understands the subjectivity of design decisions.
• Someone who values simplicity as the ultimate sophistication and pays attention to both details and the big picture.
• A fan of Apple's design philosophy who uses thoughtful animations, icons, and interactions to enhance usability.
• A natural communicator who thrives in a collaborative environment and can deliver under tight timelines.
• Someone better than us at what we do, ready to elevate our design standards to the next level.
Salary

$120,000 - $180,000 per year, depending on experience.

job_data.title: UI/UX Designer
job_data.description:
About Us

The Company

Studio Nefce exists to create soulful experiences that ethically advances our potential as humans.

Following our success as winners of the Young Innovators Awards and Fast Start, we're ready to continue the next step in our journey. To help young people improve their focus skills and become mindful of their screen time by welcoming a UI/UX Designer to our purpose-driven team.

Our Values

Balance is key to contentment and perseverance.

Honesty so we're transparent about our business and don't lose touch with reality.

Community because we do right by our diverse audience and society.

The team

Our founder Adam is the studio lead, a self-taught problem solver with design and iOS programming skills. Kris is our game designer and board game wizard.

The Problems we're tackling
• Inflated screen time
• Attention economy
• Polarised societies
• Mental health
• Entertainment diets
• Endless distractions

Our unannounced but bright idea (that needs some ):

A mobile app that rewards young people with Minecraft-like rewards for completing timed sessions away from distracting apps, allowing them to focus on their priorities.

Project goals

We won UK Government funding (Innovate UK) to develop our product with a short (two-month) project (target start date is 6th January 2025) that will:
• Modernise the look and feel of our prototype
• Design the early versions of our multiplayer and social features
• Involve our audience in the design process to constantly test our assumptions
• Start development of our iOS app with Apple's Screen Time API functionality
• Create the content our users will engage with as they progress through our experience

What we offer
• A rare opportunity to create and shape a counterintuitive gameplay experience
• Contribute to an interesting project with a clear purpose of helping young people feel in control of their time and attention
• Flexible working (open to remote or hybrid model) and four-day work week
• Influence our studio's culture, processes and habits
• Freedom to grow skills in areas that are of interest to you
• Autonomy to manage your workload
• Competitive compensation (£23-25k per annum pro-rata initially on a temporary contract with the possibility of a permanent role beyond the project)

Who are we looking for

We are looking for a talented and resourceful UI/UX designer to join our team (must be UK based or have a NI number). This person will take a lead role in crafting a fun user experience. The ideal candidate is ready to jump in and influence every aspect of the design process, from ideation, to wireframing, UX design and supporting with user testing, through to screen design, interaction design and product support.

The gig
• Create and iterate on the player experience and ensuring players have a clear understanding of our game's core loops and narrative
• Identify UX issues by prototyping, designing and presenting user flows to both wireframe quality and high-fidelity standards
• Design a high-fidelity and interactive prototype for the initial releases of our app
• Collaborate with our artist and game designer to bring to life our vision
• Involve our audience in the design process to constantly test our core assumptions and gather actionable insights
• Shape the player journey to facilitate daily engagement and good retention
• Generating and collating assets necessary to complete the UI to shipping standard
• Supporting the creation and maintenance of our design system

Your skills
• Experience creating UI/UX within the mobile tech or gaming industry
• Expertise with UI/UX design tools for wireframing and interactive prototyping such as Figma
• Excellent creative problem solving skills (creating simple solutions to complex problems)
• Highly self-motivated to make a positive impact and action-oriented
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Solid grasp of visual design and user interface design principles
• Strong presentations skills and the ability to convey an idea or vision to non-visual or art stakeholders
• Proficient in crafting high-quality UI elements and implementing them efficiently into the product

Bonuses
• Fun, good and curious character
• Attention to detail
• Relevant degree or qualifications
• Content, art or game design skills
• Experience delivering a project while working in a multidisciplinary team
• Passion for games, products and experiences of all kinds
• Up to date with UI/UX best practices, tools and trends

Hiring process
• Brief phone call to better understand your aspirations and answer your questions
• Competency interview
• Alignment interview with task presentation

How to apply?

Please email us at mailbag@ with your CV and portfolio (if you have one). In the subject line of the email, please use your initials x UI/UX Designer (eg. AD x UI/UX Designer).

Feel free to include a concise cover letter (with one or two paragraphs) that answers one of the following questions:
• What is your favourite game/product and why?
• What do you value in a digital experience and why?
• What is your relationship like with your phone and how would you help a friend with a screen time problem?

Equal opportunities

At Studio Nefce, we believe diversity of thought, background, and experience is the key to inclusive innovation that strengthens our business and will help the most people.

Each applicant has an equal opportunity, and employment decisions will be made solely based on merit and business needs.

If you require any assistance due to a disability, please let us know how we can help by reaching out to mailbag@, and we'll do our best to accommodate you.

Apply anyway.

If you're excited about one of our roles or our mission, but your CV doesn't align perfectly with the job description, please apply anyway. We want to hear from people who are excited about the problem we're solving, and we shall endeavour to involve you in our design and development process.

job_data.title: Product Designer (UX/UI)
job_data.description: Product Designer (UX/UI) Salary Circa £45,000 National / Circa £65,000 London Locations London and Norwich We are on the lookout for a Product Designer to join the User Centered Design team (UCD) here at Aviva. You will have a number of years' industry experience, working for known brands, and can demonstrate the great work you have recently undertaken. A bit about the job: The User Centered Design team defines how our customers, partners and employees interact with our products and services. As a Product Designer you will ensure that our products and features are not only easy to use and address customer needs, but also align to business strategy and objectives. You will create digital journeys for a range of platforms, running the design process from discovery through to delivery, advocating strong customer centric process and user experience. Skills & experience we’re looking for: Strong experience in UX design methods and problem-solving skills, facilitating workshops and producing artefacts such as wireframes, user flows, experience maps, IA and prototypes. Strong experience in UI design methods and principles, including design systems. Delivering pixel-perfect designs that adhere to Aviva’s brand guidelines and design standards. Ability to lead projects from discovery through to delivery, gathering requirements and actionable insights to inform design and iteratively test with customers to optimise the experience. Collaborating closely with colleagues from across Aviva to deliver the best outcomes for our customers, including Product, Engineering, Data, UX Research, Accessibility and Legal Highly skilled in using design tools such as Figma, Figjam, Photoshop, Illustrator, Optimal Workshop, and Adobe Analytics What you’ll get for this role: Our purpose - with you today, for a better tomorrow – is a promise we make to our colleagues too. And one of the ways we live up to that promise is by investing in you. We have so much to offer when it comes to being an Aviva colleague. Salary Circa £45,000 national/ Circa £65,000 London (depending on location, skills, experience, and qualifications). Bonus opportunity – 10% of annual salary Actual amount depends on your performance and Aviva’s. Generous pension scheme - Aviva will contribute up to 14%, depending on what you put in. 29 days holiday plus bank holidays, and you can choose to buy or sell up to 5 days. Make your money go further - Up to 40% discount on Aviva products, and other retailer discounts. Up to £1,200 of free Aviva shares per year through our Matching Share Plan and share in the success of Aviva with our Save As You Earn scheme. Brilliantly supportive policies including parental and carer’s leave. Flexible benefits to suit you, including sustainability options such as cycle to work. Make a difference, be part of our Aviva Communities and use your 3 paid volunteering days to help others. We take your wellbeing seriously with lots of support and tools. Take a look to learn more. Put a salary into this calculator to see what your total Aviva Reward could be. Aviva is for everyone: We’re inclusive and welcome everyone – we want applications from all backgrounds and experiences. Excited but not sure you tick every box? Even if you don’t, we would still encourage you to apply. We also consider all forms of flexible working, including part time and job shares. We flex locations, hours and working patterns to suit our customers, business, and you. Most of our people are smart working – spending around 50% of their time in our offices every week - combining the benefits of flexibility, with time together with colleagues. To find out more about working at Aviva take a look here We interview every disabled applicant who meets the minimum criteria for the job. Once you’ve applied, please send us an email stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we’ll interview you. We’d love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Sahra Abdulla a call on 07775 042 835 or send an email to sahra.abdulla@aviva.com. We help our 19.5 million customers to save for the future and manage the risks of everyday life. To give these customers the best possible products and service we know we must make Aviva the most attractive choice for talented, entrepreneurial people with diverse backgrounds and an evolving range of expertise and insight. So, we’re passionate about helping our 23,000 people to do the best work of their lives, to enable them to make a positive difference to the lives of our customers.

job_data.title: UI / UX Specialist
job_data.description:
Location: City of London

Working Arrangements: Hybrid

Duration: Initially 6 - 12 months

Overview

In this role you’ll craft the design system underpinning innovative digital experiences for audiences around the world.

You’ll leverage your skills in user interface and experience design to define the blueprint for functional and engaging web frontends.

You’ll need to enjoy working closely with designers, brand leads, product owners, frontend developers and stakeholders to interpret (and often enhance) core feature requirements and output innovative concepts.

This could be anything from beautiful high-fidelity wireframes, UI prototypes, concept pitch decks or feature blueprints.

Independently interpreting business and feature specifications and being able to articulate design concepts and rationalisation of decisions is key.

You’ll know your way around tools like Figma, Slickplan, Adobe, Azure DevOps and Monday (or similar project management suites).

You’ll know the value of human centred design (HCM) methodology and user experience design that is device agonistic, with particular attention to crafting engaging mobile experiences.

You’ll have experience stewarding design systems and libraries and championing their governance – ensuring practicality and scalability.

Experience and understanding of frontend development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) isn’t necessary, but a huge plus.

Working out of our London office, you’ll join a global team working in a very global sense. The role will have periods of pressure, but you will be surrounded by great people.

A portfolio of work is the best way to showcase your skills for this role.

About Fortescue.

Fortescue is focused on becoming the number 1 integrated green energy, metals and technology company, recognised for its culture, innovation and industry-leading development of infrastructure, mining assets and green energy initiatives. It operates with two divisions, Metals and Energy.

Fortescue is committed to producing green hydrogen, containing zero carbon, from renewable electricity. Green hydrogen is a zero-carbon fuel that, when used, produces primarily water. It is a practical and implementable solution that can help revolutionise the way we power our planet: helping to decarbonise heavy industry and create jobs globally.

job_data.title: UX Designer
job_data.description:
Job Description

Position: UX Designer

Location: Edinburgh, UK

Skills and Responsibilities:

Desirable Criteria:

Develop personas and scenarios to inform the design process; Design, assist, and analyses user research and usability testing initiatives; Assist in strategizing with client and team regarding task analysis and task completion user flows; Create content hierarchies, site maps and navigational models that are aligned with the defined, and/or expected, user experience and business requirements; Create dynamic wireframes in Axure [preferred] other prototyping tools that illustrate site layout, navigation, controls, and content prioritization; Articulate user experience issues and concerns and overall design principles to team members and clients; Translate complex concepts into interactive experiences through the design and/or implementation of web site architectures; Collaborate with designers and developers on visual comps and provide input from an information architecture perspective; Focus on HCI and user centered design principles and uses these elements as foundation for design solutions and informational approach; Consult on any changes to information flow during site build. Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud package [At least Illustrator and Photoshop] in advance level.

Desired Skills and Experience Requirements

Professional experience as an Information Architect,

User- Experience Architect, or Interaction Designer; and agency experience preferred; Deep expertise in Axure, including prototype design and component library creation;

Mid to senior-level experience in information design, with a portfolio that includes User Journey Maps and pixel perfect wireframes, while reflecting a deep understanding of scenario-based UX asset creation

job_data.title: UX UI Designer
job_data.description: UX/UI Designer Salary: Up to £55,000 per annum depending on experience, plus company benefits Contract: Permanent, full time Hours: 37.5 hours per week Shifts: Monday through Friday, flexible between the hours of 8:30am – 6:00pm Break details: 1-hour lunch, unpaid Work model: Remote (must be able to attend client sites in Central London and Norwich when required) Williams Lea and TSO seeks an experienced UX/UI Designer to join our team! Williams Lea is the leading global provider of skilled, technology-enabled, business-critical support services, with long-term trusted relationships with blue-chip clients across investment banks, law firms and professional services firms. Williams Lea employees, nearly 7000 people worldwide provide efficient business services at client sites in often complex and highly regulated environments, from centralised Williams Lea onshore facilities, and through best cost company offshore locations. TSO provides regulatory and standards publishing and technology solutions for regulators and organisations that set rules and industry adopted standards. Our brand and solutions are recognised by regulators and public sector bodies across the UK and overseas. We are recognised for ground-breaking innovation and our long heritage of service and no fail delivery. Our solutions enable our clients to manage their authoritative information so that it is structured, accurate and up to date and make it easier to use and understand. We are seeking an experienced UX/UI Designer to take ownership of crafting exceptional user experiences across our digital platforms. The ideal candidate will apply User-Centred Design (UCD) practices and align with Government Digital Service (GDS) principles where appropriate, ensuring the needs and expectations of clients and stakeholders are not only met but exceeded. Does this sound like you? Then you are just the individual that we are looking for! Purpose of this Role: Our UX/UI Designer will be responsible for crafting seamless and engaging user experiences across our digital platforms. You will own the design process end-to-end, from conducting user research and synthesising insights to creating interactive prototypes and final designs. You will work collaboratively with service design, research, and technical teams to deliver solutions that are user-centred, accessible, and aligned with business objectives. This role demands a strong ability to balance stakeholder requirements with the needs of our users and drive projects to successful completion. Key Responsibilities User Research & Insights Conduct user research using qualitative and quantitative methods, such as interviews, surveys, usability testing, and data analysis, to uncover user behaviours, needs, and pain points Synthesise research findings into actionable insights to inform design decisions Support the development of user personas, journey maps, and other artefacts to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders Experience Design (UX) Translate user insights into effective, data-driven design solutions that enhance the overall experience Create lo- and high-fidelity wireframes, prototypes, and workflows to visualise user journeys and interactions Collaborate with stakeholders to define user and business requirements, balancing both effectively Test and iterate on designs based on usability testing and feedback, ensuring continuous improvement Interface Design (UI) Design intuitive, accessible, and visually engaging interfaces that adhere to brand guidelines and align with the Government Digital Service (GDS) standards where required Ensure designs are responsive, user-friendly, and optimised for a variety of devices, including mobile and web platforms Provide detailed design specifications and artefacts for developers and collaborate during implementation to ensure fidelity to the design vision Collaboration and Communication Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and researchers, to deliver cohesive solutions Present design concepts and rationales to stakeholders at all levels, ensuring alignment and buy-in Advocate for user-centred design principles across the organisation and promote best practices Delivery and Project Leadership Lead design efforts across multiple projects, driving progress and ensuring deadlines are met Balance project goals, timelines, and resource constraints while maintaining the highest design quality Support the development of roadmaps and strategic plans for design-related initiatives Accessibility and Standards Ensure all designs meet the latest WCAG accessibility standards and are inclusive for all users. Maintain and contribute to the development and maintenance of design systems, style guides, and UI pattern libraries, ensuring consistency and efficiency across all digital products while adhering to accessibility and usability standards Qualifications and Skills Essential Bachelor's degree or equivalent 5+ years of experience as a UX/UI Designer with a proven track record of delivering impactful digital products, preferably for public sector or regulatory clients or in a public sector or professional services environment. Strong understanding of user-centred design (UCD) principles, design thinking, and data-driven design Expertise in conducting user research and usability testing, with the ability to translate findings into actionable insights Proficiency in design tools such as Axure, Figma, Sketch, or similar. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience working closely with cross-functional teams Strong knowledge of accessibility standards (e.g. WCAG) and inclusive design practices Familiarity with GDS frameworks and the Technology Code of Practice Desirable Experience working in Agile environments and collaborating with product teams Knowledge of front-end development principles (HTML, CSS) to facilitate effective collaboration with developers Rewards and Benefits We believe in supporting our employees in both their professional and personal lives. As part of our commitment to your well-being, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including but not limited to: 25 days holiday plus bank holidays Salary sacrifice schemes, retail vouchers – including our TechScheme which can be used on a range of gadgets such as Smart TV’s, laptops and computers or household appliances Life Assurance Private Medical Insurance Dental Insurance Health Assessments Cycle-to-work scheme Discounted gym memberships Referral Scheme You will also work for a global employer who is dedicated to offering each employee an enjoyable, challenging and rewarding career with future career development prospects! Equality and Diversity The Company values the differences that a diverse workforce brings to the organisation and will not discriminate because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race (which includes colour, nationality and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation (each of these being a “protected characteristic” in discrimination law). It will not discriminate because of any other irrelevant factor and will build a culture that values openness, fairness, and transparency. If you have a disability and would prefer to apply in a different format or would like to make a reasonable adjustment to enable you to make an interview, please contact us at careersatWL@williamslea.com. View our Privacy Notice https://www.williamslea.com/privacy-statement Longevity driven by innovation In a rapidly changing world, the ability to innovate and break new ground drives progress. Williams Lea has harnessed this ability for more than 200 years. Our 5,200+ talented employees worldwide are experts in delivering efficient business processes in complex and highly regulated environments. We’re always progressing. Connecting technology with expertise and strong processes to transform support services. As we enter our third century, we continue helping businesses thrive in a future driven by digitization and virtualization.

job_data.title: UI/UX Designer | London
job_data.description:
We are seeking a creative and experienced UI/UX Designer to join our team and help shape the digital experiences of our products and services. The UI/UX Designer will be responsible for designing intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces, as well as crafting seamless user experiences that drive engagement and satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to define project goals, user requirements, and design objectives.
• Conduct user research, usability testing, and analysis to gather insights and inform design decisions.
• Develop wireframes, prototypes, and user flows to visualize and communicate design concepts and interactions.
• Create high-fidelity UI designs that are visually appealing, intuitive to use, and consistent with brand guidelines.
• Ensure that all design solutions meet accessibility standards and best practices.
• Iterate on designs based on feedback, user testing results, and data-driven insights.
• Work closely with development teams to ensure that designs are implemented accurately and effectively.
• Stay current on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in UI/UX design.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive the adoption of design thinking and user-centered design principles throughout the organization.
• Contribute to the evolution of our design system and style guide, maintaining consistency and coherence across all digital touchpoints.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in design, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field; master's degree preferred.
• Proven experience in UI/UX design, with a strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of projects.
• Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
• Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, usability best practices, and interaction design concepts.
• Experience conducting user research, usability testing, and analysis.
• Strong visual design skills, with an eye for typography, color, and layout.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present and justify design decisions to stakeholders.
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, agile environment, managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

job_data.title: UI/UX Designer (Mobile Native)
job_data.description:

job_data.title: Freelance UX Designer
job_data.description:
UX Designer is needed in Glasgow, United Kingdom.

Client: 260312-South Florida Region Admin

Location: Glasgow, United Kingdom

Contract: Full-time
Job Description

You are a highly creative, passionate, and driven individual who will focus on Digital Document Solutions and create a better experience for our global network of clients, customers, and employees. As a Senior UX Designer at JPMorgan Chase within the Corporate Technology Experience team, you will combine exceptional craft in visual design with strong problem-solving and communication skills. You are a master with Figma and capable of quickly drawing wireframes to effectively communicate ideas. Collaboration with designers, researchers, product managers, and developers is key to creating designs that balance user needs, business objectives, and technology. You are detail-oriented and advocate for the user.
Responsibilities
• Creating wireframes and interactive POCs leveraging our design system.
• Working with project teams and researchers to understand our users.
• Collaborating with business analysts and developers to define user stories and product backlogs.
• Participating in usability research to iterate and refine designs.
• Presenting ideas to stakeholders and advocating for the user.
• Collaborating with developers to realize and polish user experiences.
• Actively contributing to and using common design language and design systems.
• Mentoring and offering guidance to junior designers.
• Collaborating with the team and stakeholders to create UX artifacts such as journey maps, empathy maps, and personas.
• Leading the UX design process for multiple projects.
• Evangelizing UX to business, stakeholders, and technology.
Requirements

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Bachelor’s degree in Human Computer Interaction, Interaction/Interface Design, Graphic Design, Technology Communications, or a related discipline from a major accredited college or university.
• Advanced applied experience or equivalent compelling experiences as a designer for enterprise software, responsive web applications, mobile apps, and defining in-house style guides & documenting standards.
• Expert with modern design tools – Figma, Sketch, Invision, or equivalent.
• A balance of creativity, productivity, and a passion for elegant, simple, emotionally rich design.
• Excellent communication, listening, and negotiation skills with clients and senior executives; ability to write, speak, and present information effectively, persuasively, and confidently in various settings.
• Strong understanding and commitment to usability and user-centered design principles/methods, including a variety of usability evaluation techniques such as usability testing, contextual interviews, and heuristic evaluations.
• Strong understanding of Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0) and assistive technologies (JAWS, NVDA, Zoomtext), with a proven track record of incorporating them into daily work.
• Experience across multiple teams and release cycles, working closely with design, product management, and development to realize experiences using agile project management.
• A11y knowledge/experience.

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Master’s degree in Human Computer Interaction, Design, Technology Communications, or a related discipline.
• Working knowledge of modern web application technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Angular, Bootstrap, LESS/Sass, React.
• Experience in conducting UX Research.
Additional Information

This role is focused on creating solutions that enhance the user experience for a global client base, emphasizing collaboration, advocacy for users, and adherence to usability standards and principles.
