job_data.title: Principal Product Manager - Intuit Assist (AI)
job_data.description:
Intuit’s Expert Network is the driving force behind Intuit’s AI-powered human-enabled services and product support for consumers and small businesses, which enables service revenue as part of Big Bet 2: Connecting people to Experts, Our vision is to become the Expert Network of Choice for all professionals.

We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative Principal Product Manager responsible for revolutionizing and delivering our vision of an AI-led “done-for-me world” for our Experts across the entire E2E experience, including onboarding, training, workflows, and processes.

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering AI and other breakthrough technology and experiences at scale in close partnership with data scientists, designers, engineers, program managers, and senior leadership. You will have also delivered platform experiences and capabilities that support multiple teams and Business Units. You have demonstrated excellence in the core skills of PM, from deep customer empathy (the Heart), and strong analytical and data skills (the Brain), to rallying a team and an organization around the most important priorities (the Muscle). You will lead a team of skilled product managers and coach them in the craft of product management.

You will join a collaborative and dynamic team of world-class product managers and cross-functional partners who are shaping a critical component of Intuit’s next phase of growth.

If you are passionate about solving customer problems, want to learn from the best and thrive in a role where people, processes, and AI-driven technology fuel growth and innovation, then we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities
• Conceptualize, identify, and spearhead the biggest opportunities to deploy Intuit Assist and other AI capabilities at key touch points of the expert journey to accelerate the growth and efficiency of our services across Intuit products.
• Translate opportunities into a roadmap of strategies and tactics, provide clear prioritization using appropriate quantitative and qualitative measures, and drive alignment across stakeholders, including defining a small set of critical KPIs that measure the right outcomes.
• Create clear requirements that inspire cross-functional partners to conceptualize and ship awesome experiences where humans and tech work effortlessly and seamlessly side by side to delight customers.
• Hone the practice of iterating post-feature release to maximize expert adoption, including seeking the voice of the expert, never settling for good enough.
• Bring a structured approach to problem-solving, including data and pattern analysis to spot new trends. Turn insights into recommendations for experience and process improvements and efficiency gains.
• Raise the bar on yourself and your peers by continuously learning and providing training on applicable product experiences and products, keeping the team on the cutting edge of innovation.
• Keep an outside-in view of the landscape by staying up-to-date on industry trends and best practices related to integrating AI/Gen AI models into our network operations.

job_data.title: Product Manager - AI, ML Operations - Vice President
job_data.description:
Job Description
Want to use the power of AI/ML to innovate and reinvent the future?
As a Product Manager in the AI/ML Solutions Platform team, you are an integral part of the team that innovates and leads the end-to-end product life cycle for our AI/ML platform. You are responsible for acting as the voice of the customer and developing solutions that enable and accelerate the development of AI/ML use cases. Utilizing your deep understanding of how to get a product off the ground, you guide the successful launch of products, gather crucial feedback, and ensure top-tier customer experiences. With a strong commitment to scalability, resiliency, and stability, you collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality AI/ML products that exceed customer expectations.
You enjoy shaping the future of AI/ML innovation as a core leader, driving value for customers, guiding successful launches, and exceeding expectations. Join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact by delivering high-quality AI/ML capabilities.
Job Responsibilities:
• Develops a product strategy and vision for AI/ML platforms that deliver value to customers
• Manages discovery efforts and market research to uncover customer solutions and integrate them into the product roadmap
• Owns, maintains, and develops a product backlog that enables development to support the overall strategic roadmap and value proposition
• Builds the framework and tracks the product's key success metrics such as cost, feature and functionality, risk posture, and reliability
• Focuses on Feature Platform, Model Experimentation, Model Serving, and MLOps to enhance the AI/ML lifecycle

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• 5+ years of experience or equivalent expertise in product management or a relevant domain area
• Advanced knowledge of the product development life cycle, design, and data analytics
• Proven ability to lead product life cycle activities including discovery, ideation, strategic development, requirements definition, and value management

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Demonstrated prior experience working in a highly matrixed, complex organization
• Experience with AI/ML technologies, particularly in Feature Platform, Model Experimentation, Model Serving, and MLOps
• Strong understanding of market trends and customer needs in the AI/ML space
• *** Relocation assistance is not available for this role.
About Us
Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.
We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set and location. Those in eligible roles may receive commission-based pay and/or discretionary incentive compensation, paid in the form of cash and/or forfeitable equity, awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans
About the Team
Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We're proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions - all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.
The CCB Data & Analytics team responsibly leverages data across Chase to build competitive advantages for the businesses while providing value and protection for customers. The team encompasses a variety of disciplines from data governance and strategy to reporting, data science and machine learning. We have a strong partnership with Technology, which provides cutting edge data and analytics infrastructure. The team powers Chase with insights to create the best customer and business outcomes.

items: 5+ years of experience or equivalent expertise in product management or a relevant domain area
Advanced knowledge of the product development life cycle, design, and data analytics
Proven ability to lead product life cycle activities including discovery, ideation, strategic development, requirements definition, and value management

items: We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set and location

Those in eligible roles may receive commission-based pay and/or discretionary incentive compensation, paid in the form of cash and/or forfeitable equity, awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions
We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility

job_highlights.title: Responsibilities

You are responsible for acting as the voice of the customer and developing solutions that enable and accelerate the development of AI/ML use cases
Utilizing your deep understanding of how to get a product off the ground, you guide the successful launch of products, gather crucial feedback, and ensure top-tier customer experiences

job_data.title: AI Product Manager - AIPRO003624
job_data.description:
About the position

The AI Product Manager will be responsible for supporting our clients through technology change and aiding people to develop new processes around innovation. We are seeking someone with a knowledge of technology and change management to work closely with stakeholders to transform business processes and successfully adopt new automation and AI. You will work with our clients to contribute to their enterprise transformation initiatives and collaborate with relevant technology partners to facilitate training, product updates, project communication, and process improvement recommendations. The AI Product Manager is also able to communicate directly with clients to further refine products and processes based on client needs. The AI Product Manager will analyze the latest advancement in key products and services areas such as AI, Digital Transformation, and Cloud-based applications to support HORNE's positioning to successfully implement new technology to meet our clients' needs.

Responsibilities
• Work with AI & Innovation team to establish scope, deliverables and resources requirements.
,
• Develop and execute a comprehensive data and AI strategy to enhance customer experiences by leveraging data technologies, AI and Gen AI.
,
• Conduct market research and gather customer insights to drive product development.
,
• Stay ahead of AI industry trends and competitor strategies to maintain a competitive edge.
,
• Lead the development of product backlogs for building and scaling AI capabilities.
,
• Drive the entire product lifecycle from ideation through launch.
,
• Collaborate with engineering teams to design, build, and refine AI-driven features and capabilities that meet the needs.
,
• Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, data science, UX/UI, marketing, and sales, to ensure product vision alignment and to drive the successful execution of product initiatives.
,
• Measure product performance and identify opportunities for optimization and growth.
,
• Implement metrics and KPIs to track the success of AI initiatives.
,
• Articulate value proposition of new AI and technology features to stakeholders to drive adoption and prepare presentations to senior leaders across domains and functions.
,
• Coordinate across Focus Areas (Industry/Sector and IT) to support transformation initiatives.
,
• Design new product and services, relay any challenges and resolutions to leadership, and communicate milestones to appropriate stakeholders in a clear, accurate, and timely manner.
,
• Manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects using an Agile approach.

Requirements
• Five (5) to seven (7) years' experience in Data and/or AI tech product management.
,
• Experience with AI/ML solutions, digital applications, and modern cloud-based platforms.
,
• Agile practitioner with experience collaborating across multi-disciplinary pods.
,
• Previous hands-on experience with value stream mapping.
,
• Experience collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams to drive adoption of new solutions.
,
• Experience with roadmap prioritization and communicating benefits of new technology.
,
• Strong problem-solving skills with experience exercising mature judgment and bridging gaps.
,
• Able to write and present in a clear and succinct manner that appeals to a wide audience.
,
• Ability to identify gaps in organization's posture for change, including AI and technologies.

Nice-to-haves
• Bachelor's degree in data, technology / STEM or MBA with technical focus preferred.
,
• Experience working with Lean Six Sigma and business process re-engineering.

Benefits
• A forward thinking, anticipatory professional driven by a passion to pursue your full potential and dreams.
,
• A work environment that promotes collaboration, consistency, and community service to empower people.
,
• An inclusive culture that promotes career/life integration and invests in developing people in areas of focused expertise.
,
• An unrivaled distinctive, special culture that values collaboration, innovation, and positive energy which HORNE calls "Deliver with Care."
,
• A team of professionals grounded in strong, personal relationships and a sense of belonging to a common purpose for adding value and making a difference.
,
• A dedicated team of individuals from diverse backgrounds working together to leave our clients better than we found them.
,
• Focus on reaching our full potential, rewards high performance, and prioritizes leadership development for every team member.
,
• Emphasizes health and personal development through multiple wellness programs.

job_data.title: Product Manager, AI/ML, Google Cloud
job_data.description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA.

Minimum qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
• 5 years of experience in product management or related technical role.
• 2 years of experience taking technical products from conception to launch.
• Experience developing or launching products or technologies within Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning (AI or ML).

Preferred qualifications:
• Master's degree in a technology or business related field.
• 3 years of experience in a business function or role (e.g., strategic marketing, business operations, consulting).
• 3 years of experience in a role preparing and delivering technical presentations to senior leadership.
• 2 years of experience in software development or engineering.
• 2 years of experience working cross-functionally with engineering, UX/UI, sales finance, and other stakeholders.
• 1 year of experience in technical leadership.

About the job

At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development.One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.
XLA is Google's ML compiler, one of the world's preeminent ML Software applications, and is used to run all of Google's internal workloads.
We work very closely with all of Google's internal ML teams - DeepMind/Gemini, Ads, Cloud, Bard, Magi, YouTube, as well as with some of the largest external foundation model training teams.
Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The US base salary range for this full-time position is $142,000-$211,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.
Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more aboutbenefits at Google.

Responsibilities
• Develop the strategic vision for major components of Google’s critical ML hardware stack, including incorporating cutting-edge ML innovations and delivering state-of-the-art performance for internal and major Cloud customers.
• Engage with Google's largest ML product areas (DeepMind, Cloud, Search, Ads, YouTube, and others) and Cloud's largest ML-focused customers to inform Google's ML Software approach to identify the most impactful areas for XLA development.
• Work closely with ML Hardware NPI teams, customer engineering, and software partners to ensure our roadmap is timely and delivers planned NPI and customer impact.
• Drive coherence between hardware and software development programs to enable most productive use of our ML hardware.
• Develop effective partnerships with associated ML Software teams, including CoreML Frameworks (TensorFlow, JAX, PyTorch) and Cloud GPU/TPU, and understand their evolving needs for large-scale Generative AI training and serving.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

job_data.title: Principal Product Manager - AI/ML Platform
job_data.description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience #LifeatVisa.

Job Description

The Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) Products & Platforms team is creating the next generation of scalable and responsible AI, ML, and data innovations and products to solve client and consumer problems. This is a cross-functional team of AI & data scientists, AI/ML engineers, data engineers, product managers, and program managers focused on generating value for the payment’s ecosystem.

Visa’s AI/ML models and products are an essential part of the world’s economy, as they play a key role in preventing fraud across the payments ecosystem and generate high value for clients and consumers, all within milliseconds. Our AI/ML solutions generate hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue for Visa and protect billions of dollars of payment transactions.

Essential Functions:

This position will be a key member of the AIML Platform Product leadership team responsible for the AIaS (AI as a Service) portfolio, powered by the AIML Platform, including both traditional and GenAI.
• Drive the development of the AIML platform to support value-added services portfolios, aligning with broader organizational strategies and goals.
• Play an instrumental role in the A2A (Account to Account) portfolio of products by providing thought leadership in overall strategy, design, execution, and launch of model products.
• This role is accountable for the end-to-end implementation of the AIML stack both on-prem and in a multi-cloud environment, partnering closely with data science, technology, and operations teams.
• Partner with technology architects on cloud solutions that bring together Visa’s products, technologies, software, and ecosystem to provide best-in-class performance, availability, and scalability.
• Platform Strategy & Roadmap: Identify trends, competitive landscape, market, and client needs to shape the product roadmap and align strategic goals.
• Build and own the platform roadmap, product positioning, market differentiation, value proposition, and benefits in ways that resonate with key audiences, use cases, and markets.
• Establish product requirements: Define comprehensive and precise product requirements for key features that meet client and market needs and work in conjunction with other Visa products and solutions.
• Lead grooming sessions: Drive collaboration and in-depth understanding of product and model requirements with cross-functional product, data science, and technology teams.
• Define acceptance criteria for requirements, participating and leading AI design and technology discussions.
• Define and monitor key platform success metrics, SLAs, and operational targets.
• Lead non-technical and functional elements critical to product success, such as model risk management, model onboarding experience, and oversee the technical development of the platform, ensuring that communicated timelines and quality standards are met.
• Ideate, prototype, and collaborate with AIML teams in building the business case.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to finalize requirements and establish a clear path to delivery for various use cases.
• Adapt to changes in the rapidly evolving AI/ML landscape, influencing the development of platform capabilities accordingly.
• Understand the needs of product partners and data scientists and translate them into an efficient, reliable platform for building, testing, and deploying AI models.
• Identify significant opportunities for building applications on the AIML Platform, drive use case assessment, and support prioritization in alignment with broader organizational strategies and goals.
• Lead with vision, identifying new technologies for adoption, and be the lead PM voice for interactions with public cloud providers, such as AWS and GCP, as well as the internal Visa O&I team.
• Partner closely with technology to execute on AI/ML capabilities and technologies that drive product delivery of high-profile core Visa AI products that form the strategic pillars of Visa.
• Conceptualize, develop, and launch new products and experiences at the intersection of payments and technology in the AI space.
• Liaise with other business units, product leaders, engineering, and other applicable groups to ensure flawless execution.
• Develop and advocate a vision of outstanding customer experience powered by advanced AI technologies.
• Influence others within and outside of the job sub-function regarding practices, procedures, and policies.
• Experience building cloud-native architectures, architecting enterprise applications on public cloud platforms, and cloud ecosystems including AWS, GCP, or Azure.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Requirements Gathering: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into product requirements.
• Product Requirements: Develop product requirements based on the product partners’ needs. This includes working closely with the engineering team to ensure the product is built to specification and meets the needs of our users.
• Team Leadership: Lead and manage a cross-functional team of product managers, designers, and engineers. Foster a culture of innovation, excellence, and accountability.
• Stakeholder Communication: Regularly communicate with stakeholders across the organization, including senior leadership, to keep them informed of the initiative’s progress and to gather their input.
• User Advocacy: Advocate for the needs of our users (data scientists) throughout the product development process. Ensure the final product meets their needs and enhances their ability to build, test, and deploy AI models.
• Market Analysis: Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, advancements in AI/ML, and emerging technologies. Use this knowledge to keep our product competitive, drive innovation, and new product development.
• Product Vision and Strategy: Define the product vision and strategy for supporting partners’ portfolios and for developing applications for the AIML Platform and define the roadmaps, ensuring they align with the AIML Platform’s and company's overall AI/ML strategies.
• This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 5% of the time.

Strategic and Functional Excellence:
• Strong interpersonal, leadership, verbal, and written communication skills to effectively partner, influence, and instill confidence with stakeholders across all functional teams.
• Outstanding organizational, communication, and relationship-building skills conducive to driving consensus and able to work in a cross-functional, matrix management environment.
• Strong technical, analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
• Flexible and creative thinker with the ability to define business tradeoffs.
• Strong quantitative skills with a “data first” mindset. Ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.
• A proven track record of success in fast-paced environments with demanding timelines is also required.
• Strong problem solver, with exposure to and knowledge of industry-standard AI and ML technologies with expertise to drive technology-related and architecture discussions.
• High degree of competence in working independently with limited oversight from the manager on undefined and unique problems and an extreme sense of ownership.

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
• 12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 10 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g., Masters/MBA/JD/MD), or a minimum of 5 years of work experience with a PhD.

Preferred Qualifications:
• 15 or more years of experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 12 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g., Masters, MBA, JD, or MD), PhD with 9+ years of experience.
• Strong understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, with an emphasis on AI models in batch and real-time environments.
• Strong experience in data science, deep learning models, cloud computing, and experience with big data and broader AI/ML tools, platforms, and technologies.
• Relevant experience with the AI/ML cloud stack and architecting large enterprise systems.
• Proficiency with software development methodologies such as Agile and experience working with Scrum teams and matrix organizations.
• Prior experience working within an agile product development environment.
• Advanced proficiency in the use of MS Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and SharePoint).
• Modeling experience in the card industry or financial service company using for fraud, credit risk, payments is a plus.
• 7+ years of experience in developing and delivering Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence solutions at the enterprise or organizational level to solve customer or business problems.
• Experience in and/or significant exposure to the payments industry specifically, within new applications, fraud risk, identity risk, or Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Data Science.
• 10 years of experience in product management, with demonstrated ability to launch and manage new product releases being part of a matrix organization in a highly technical and evolving AI/ML space.
• Strong business acumen and knowledge of machine learning or data processing algorithms for risk and fraud applications.
• Experience in financial services and payments desired, but not required.
• Experience partnering with technologists using Agile or other expedited design and development methodologies. Working knowledge of Agile tools such as Confluence Wiki, Tableau, and JIRA is strongly preferred.

Additional Information

Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.

Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 213,000.00 to 332,950.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.

apply_options.title: Jobs And Talents In AI, ML, Data Science And Big Data

job_data.title: Senior Staff Product Manager - AI Analytics Growth
job_data.description:
It is an exciting time to be joining Intuit as we continue to leverage AI and increasingly GenAI

to drive prosperity for small-medium businesses and individuals across the US and world.

Through our four big product brands Quickbooks, TurboTax, Mailchimp and Credit Karma we

support millions of US and global customers.

We have big ambitions and to achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship

innovative experiences for our customers all around the globe. Our Modernization Analytics

growth team exists to maximize the value of data throughout Intuit by improving the velocity

of data driven decisioning and innovation of Intuit’s business users, data analysts, data

scientists, and machine learning practitioners. Our team enables Intuit data to scale

effectively and evolve rapidly by providing highly performant, secure, compliant, and flexible

data analysis & insight capabilities that support the expanding needs of the businesses. We

aim to democratize data by making it more accessible and useful to technical and

non-technical employees.

We are looking for a Senior Staff Product Manager to help drive the next evolution of our

analytics experiences at Intuit. Your mission is to simplify and accelerate end-to-end data

analysis and consumption experiences at Intuit. You will lead the vision, strategy and

execution for our data analysis capabilities and use AI knowledge to address an array of

product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners from Data

Analytics, Product, Engineering, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance, and others.

The scope and impact of this role is significant. You will be responsible for managing multiple

GenAI powered analytical capabilities as products and driving holistic AI first product strategy

and prioritization across them. If you are looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic

opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of Intuit, we would love to talk to

you!
Responsibilities
• Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and strategic pivoting is part of remaining ahead of the industry curve.
• Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and Analytics/AI industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy, maximizing business and customer impact.
• Partner closely with senior management and analytics teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps.
• Develop AI-first product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product, engineering and analytics teams that execute product vision and strategy.
• Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages proactive & quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success.
• Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions.
• Foster a collaborative environment with Intuit engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we solve the right problems and drive maximum impact for Intuit.
• Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways and leveraging data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity.
• Ensure thoughtful product evolution that organically accelerates product adoption.

job_data.title: Senior AI Product Manager
job_data.description:
Work Place Flexibility: Hybrid

Legal Entity: Entergy Services, Inc.-ESI (OLD)

This position is onsite 3 days a week in New Orleans, LA or The Woodlands, TX. Relocation assistance and sponsorship is not provided.

JOB SUMMARY/PURPOSE

Job Summary:

The Product Manager role within our utility company is pivotal in orchestrating product development, overseeing delivery teams (referred to as pods), and establishing and refining a repeatable and agile delivery methodology. This role involves leading and directing the daily operations of these teams, ensuring their performance aligns with established benchmarks, and cultivating an agile culture conducive to efficient product delivery.

Purpose Statement:

This role’s primary purpose is to spearhead product development efforts, leveraging organized delivery teams (pods) and maintaining a dynamic, repeatable agile delivery methodology. It entails not only leading the day-to-day activities of these teams but also monitoring and reporting their performance to ensure alignment with objectives. Moreover, fostering an agile delivery culture is paramount to this role’s responsibilities because it promotes an environment where innovation, collaboration, and adaptability drive successful product delivery within the organization.

JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES
• Project Vision: Develop and articulate a clear product vision aligned with the utility’s goals and customer needs.
• Project Planning: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create project plans, defining scope, timelines, and resource requirements.
• Execution Oversight: Lead the execution phase, ensuring that project activities are on track and in line with the established roadmap.
• Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks that may impact project delivery, implementing contingency plans when necessary.
• Program Alignment: Ensure product initiatives align with broader program objectives and organizational strategies.
• Resource Coordination: Coordinate resources across multiple product-related projects to optimize efficiency and minimize bottlenecks.
• Program Governance: Oversee adherence of governance standards within the product management domain.
• Portfolio Strategy: Contribute to defining and refining the product portfolio strategy, aligning it with market demands and business goals.
• Performance Tracking: Monitor and assess the performance of products within the portfolio, making data-driven decisions to maximize value and ROI.
• Portfolio Optimization: Optimize the product portfolio by evaluating market trends, customer feedback, and technological advancements.
• Team Leadership: Lead and inspire cross-functional teams, including the pods, fostering a collaborative and innovative working environment.
• Change Management: Drive strategic change initiatives within the product management domain, ensuring teams adapt to evolving market landscapes and customer needs.
• Decision-making: Make informed and timely decisions, guiding teams toward successful product launches and adaptations based on market feedback.
• Product Development: Drives product development to launch and post-launch iterations.
• Customer Satisfaction Analysis: Facilitates customer feedback to inform product decisions, ensuring products meet business requirements.
• Product Strategy: Define and refine product strategies, ensuring they align with customer needs, competitive landscapes, and technological advancements.
• Methodology Establishment: Develop, refine, and maintain an agile delivery methodology tailored to the unique needs of product management within the company.
• Agile Implementation: Guide teams in the implementation of agile principles, facilitating iterative development and continuous improvement processes.
• Culture Cultivation: Foster an agile culture within the product management domain, emphasizing adaptability, collaboration, and responsiveness to change.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Minimum education required of the position

A Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Business Administration, Information Technology, or a closely related discipline is required. Additionally, candidates should possess a strong academic background with coursework or specialization in strategic planning, project management, and leadership. Equivalent professional experience in the field demonstrating expertise and a proven track record in technical planning and delivery.

Minimum experience required of the position
• Sr Staff Level: 7+ years of leading products, projects, or programs, preferably within the utility industry
• Experience with process improvements and optimizations.
• Experience with strategy and change management for an office function.
• Experienced in both Agile and Waterfall methodology and JIRA tool.

Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required of the position

The ideal candidate will bring a combination of educational achievements, professional certifications, and a substantial track record of hands-on experience in AI planning and delivery, reflecting both technical proficiency and strategic leadership capabilities.
• Comprehensive understanding of project management methodologies, business strategy formulation and implementation, and change management principles and practices.
• Strong skills in overseeing the successful execution of projects, leading organizational change, and establishing and managing key performance indicators (KPIs) for projects, focusing on continuous improvement.
• Capacity to navigate and lead in a rapidly evolving technological landscape, with a mindset that encourages and embraces innovation while demonstrating influencing skills to gain support for AI initiatives from
• Stakeholders at various organizational levels.

Any certificates, licenses, etc. required for the position

Program Management Professional (PMP) certification, Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) certification preferred

job_data.title: VP, Product Management - AI Services
job_data.description:
CoreWeave is the AI Hyperscaler™, delivering a cloud platform of cutting edge services powering the next wave of AI. Our technology provides enterprises and leading AI labs with the most performant, efficient and resilient solutions for accelerated computing. Since 2017, CoreWeave has operated a growing footprint of data centers covering every region of the US and across Europe. CoreWeave was ranked as one of the TIME100 most influential companies of 2024.

As the leader in the industry, we thrive in an environment where adaptability and resilience are key. Our culture offers career-defining opportunities for those who excel amid change and challenge. If you’re someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is eager to make a significant impact, CoreWeave is the place for you. Join us, and be part of a team solving some of the most exciting challenges in the industry.

CoreWeave powers the creation and delivery of the intelligence that drives innovation.

About The Role

As the VP of Product Management - AI Services, you will lead CoreWeave's strategic efforts in shaping and developing cutting-edge AI services that drive innovation and business outcomes for our customers. You will lead a team of Product Managers and collaborate closely with engineers and designers to create world-class products that empower organizations to deploy, scale, and optimize AI applications efficiently and effectively.

The ideal candidate is passionate about AI and cloud technologies, with a deep understanding of the AI application ecosystem, cloud-native architectures, and the competitive landscape. You will leverage market insights and technical expertise to define the product vision, roadmap, and go-to-market strategy, ensuring that CoreWeave builds on its market-segment position as the leading AI Hyperscaler.

Key Responsibilities
• Product Vision and Strategy: Help refine the product strategy for AI application cloud services aimed at foundational model training and Inference, along with focus on optimization across the entire CoreWeave product portfolio for Foundation Model Training & Inference.
• Roadmap Development: Own the product roadmap, balancing near-term customer needs with long-term vision, to deliver differentiated and scalable AI cloud services.
• AI and Cloud Expertise: Stay current on advancements in AI/ML technologies, cloud infrastructures, and software development methodologies to inform product decisions and foster innovation.
• Customer Engagement: Collaborate with key customers to understand their AI workloads, pain points, and future requirements to continuously improve our service offerings.
• Cross-functional Leadership: Lead a high-performing product management team and collaborate with engineering, sales, marketing, and customer success teams to ensure seamless product development and deployment.
• Market Analysis: Analyze market trends, customer feedback, and the competitive landscape to identify growth opportunities and ensure CoreWeave stays ahead of industry trends.
• Go-to-Market Strategy: Partner with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for AI cloud services, including positioning, messaging, and competitive differentiation.

Qualifications
• Experience: 10+ years of experience in product management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role in the cloud services or AI/ML market.
• Technical Knowledge: Deep understanding of AI/ML workloads, cloud infrastructure (GPUs), and cloud-native architectures (Kubernetes, microservices).
• Leadership: Proven ability to lead and scale product teams, with strong decision-making, project management, and mentoring skills.
• Customer-Centric Approach: Demonstrated experience working closely with customers to identify needs and translate them into product features and solutions.
• Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to influence cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
• Education: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field. MBA or equivalent experience is a plus.
• Visionary Leadership: Ability to think strategically while being able to dive into technical details to guide the product team.
• Results-Oriented: Proven track record of driving business growth through innovative product solutions in the AI and cloud space.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $275,000-$340,000. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

What We Offer

The range we’ve posted represents the typical compensation range for this role. To determine actual compensation, we review the market rate for each candidate which can include a variety of factors. These include qualifications, experience, interview performance, and location.

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a variety of benefits to support your needs, including:
• Medical, dental, and vision insurance - 100% paid for by CoreWeave
• Company-paid Life Insurance
• Voluntary supplemental life insurance
• Short and long-term disability insurance
• Flexible Spending Account
• Health Savings Account
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Mental Wellness Benefits through Spring Health
• Family-Forming support provided by Carrot
• Paid Parental Leave
• Flexible, full-service childcare support with Kinside
• 401(k) with a generous employer match
• Flexible PTO
• Catered lunch each day in our office and data center locations
• A casual work environment
• A work culture focused on innovative disruption

Our Workplace

At CoreWeave, we are committed to operating as a hybrid workplace, offering employees flexibility in how they structure their time between in-office and remote work. We recognize the significance of fostering connections, collaboration, and creativity within our office culture and its positive impact on our business. Our philosophy operating as a hybrid workplace underscores our dedication to enabling employees to tailor work-life balance to their individual preferences.

For those who do not live within 30 miles of one of our offices, we are open to considering remote work for candidates whose skills and experience strongly align with the role. While we prioritize a hybrid work environment for most roles, we understand the importance of flexibility and are open to remote work for specific positions and specialized skill sets. Onboarding is essential to your success. New employees not based out of an office will be invited to attend onboarding training at one of our hubs within their first month of employment. We continue to foster a collaborative environment by bringing teams together quarterly.

California Consumer Privacy Act - California applicants only

CoreWeave is an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace. All qualified applicants and candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information.

As part of this commitment and consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), CoreWeave will ensure that qualified applicants and candidates with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations for the hiring process, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please contact: careers@coreweave.com.

job_data.title: Senior Product Manager, Enterprise Mobility AI & Security
job_data.description:
Lab Summary:

Are you passionate about transforming bleeding-edge technologies into services that will impact millions in our daily lives? At Mobile Platform Solutions (MPS), we are looking for passionate product managers to share their creative vision and to build applications and services for Samsung's array of devices spanning mobile, wearables, IoT, TVs, appliances, etc. In this position, you will join a collaborative team of world-class designers, researchers, and engineers in the field of AI/ML, blockchain, IAM, computer vision, AR/VR/XR, IOT technologies, with emphasis on mobile B2B services, security and privacy, Enterprise AI, etc.

Come join the Samsung MPS team and be a leader in bringing futuristic services to life!

Position Summary:

The Senior Product Manager will work closely with various internal organizations including business development, engineering and designers to define requirements and roadmaps. This is a great opportunity to lead one or more of our Knox enterprise mobility advanced products focused on AI & Security. The ideal candidate will own & drive product roadmaps, strategy and execution for Intelligent device management and productivity solutions catering to large enterprises.

Position Responsibilities:
• Drive and execute product vision, strategy, and roadmap for advancing AI/Gen AI capabilities for Samsung Knox Enterprise Device Management & Mobile endpoint security solutions
• Understand and analyze Enterprise ecosystem advanced AI & Generative AI capabilities and evaluate application towards new product ideas and features
• Work with industry leading ecosystem partners including OS Platforms, UEM Platforms, Security Solution Providers, ISVs and System Integrators to identify & validate opportunities for Samsung to innovate and increase market share
• Discover use cases and develop prioritized features for integration with widely used UEM platforms, Network solutions providers and ISV solution providers
• Demonstrate customer obsession by being a champion for user experience with deep customer empathy
• Analyze market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape to identify opportunities
• Collaborate with engineering, sales, and marketing teams to ensure robust GTM plans and successful product launches
• Engage with key enterprise customers to gather feedback and validate product direction
• Be a Product Subject Matter Expert for internal as well as external stakeholders

Required Skills:
• Engineering degree in EE, CS (Masters or MBA preferred) or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
• 7+ years of product management experience in enterprise mobility or related fields
• Proven record of shipping advanced AI/GenAI enabled platform products
• Expertise in AI technologies relating to mobile endpoint management and security
• Deep understanding of Mobile Device Management and Security ecosystem including UEM platforms, SIEM, SOAR, XDR solutions management for large enterprises
• Working knowledge on IT Admin needs for enterprise device deployment & management
• Proven track record of successfully driving innovation and launching enterprise-grade mobility solutions
• Strong vision for the future of intelligent manageability and security solutions for frontline and knowledge workers powered by Enterprise AI capabilities
• Experience working with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment
• Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills
• Ability to build an excellent user experience and lead/present small group and/or executive level discussions
• Able to travel internationally (<25%)

job_data.title: Senior Product Manager, AI/ML
job_data.description:
Who We Are

At Gretel, we're building the platform that developers and data scientists trust for safe, AI-ready data. Our platform combines differential privacy with state-of-the-art AI to generate synthetic data across multiple modalities, whether starting from your own unique data or creating entirely new datasets from prompts. We enable organizations to unlock sensitive data for AI development and analytics. We believe you shouldn't have to search for the right dataset, you should be able to generate exactly what you need while maintaining the highest standards of privacy and utility.

We’re a highly collaborative remote-first company with employees across the US and Canada. Our innovative and transparent culture offers employees the autonomy, tools, and trust to act like owners and we're looking for a talented Senior Product Manager to join our mission!

The Impact You’ll Have

As a Senior Product Manager, focused on AI/ML you will play a pivotal role in the development and enhancement of our synthetic data platform, focusing on delivering solutions that meet the evolving needs of our developers and enterprise clients. You will work at the intersection of AI, product development, and market strategy to drive product growth and adoption.

​​This role requires a thorough understanding of machine learning fundamentals, cloud services, including infrastructure management, cloud-based data storage, and computing platforms. Your responsibilities will include writing detailed requirements for partner integrations, ensuring seamless compatibility, optimized performance, and adherence to security protocols.

Key Responsibilities
• Collaborate closely with the Applied Science and Engineering teams to identify complex data problems faced by customers and devise innovative synthetic data solutions.
• Lead the integration and practical application of scientific research into product features, ensuring that technical innovations translate into real-world benefits for users.
• Facilitate rapid prototyping and iterative development methodologies to accelerate product enhancements and feature rollout.
• Drive the development of tools and APIs that enable seamless integration with partner platforms, enhancing the functionality and accessibility of Gretel’s synthetic data capabilities.
• Act as a bridge between technical teams and customer-facing units, translating advanced data science concepts into marketable product features that solve tangible business problems.
• Prioritize product backlog and project timelines to ensure that team efforts are aligned with strategic business goals and deliver tangible results promptly.

Minimum Requirements
• 5+ years of industry experience, including at least 3+ years in a product management role with a focus in Machine Learning, AI, or related technologies
• Strong technical background, ideally with experience in cloud services and generative AI technologies.
• Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
• Scrappy and execution oriented, capable of making decisions and delivering results quickly.

Preferred, but not required
• Proven ability to negotiate and manage complex partner and customer relationships, and deliver successful solutions.
• Prior startup experience, ideally building products from 0-1
• Prior software engineering, MLE or data science experience

We think the best ideas come from the blending of diverse perspectives and experiences, which will lead to a stronger company and advancements in technologies. We hire individuals whose peers call them subject matter experts, whose curiosity draws them to new edges of their field and who like to laugh. We are deeply collaborative, apolitical and mission-oriented.

Gretel is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Gretel are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Accommodations: We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all candidates and employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

Compensation

Employee compensation will be determined based on interview performance, level of experience, specialization of skills, and market rate. During the offer discussion, your recruiter will review the finalized base salary, bonus (for applicable roles), benefits and perks (additional information available on our career site), and stock options as they’ll be reflected in the offer letter.

Additionally, the value of Gretel.ai’s stock options is not included in the salary bands and may represent a significant portion of your compensation.)

job_data.title: Sr Product Manager, GenAI
job_data.description:
Role Overview:
McAfee is looking for a seasoned Senior Product Manager to lead the development of innovative, consumer-facing products in the Generative AI (GenAI) scam security space. This is a high-impact role that demands an entrepreneurial mindset, strategic vision, and a deep understanding of the B2C market. As a Senior Product Manager, you will spearhead the development of solutions that empower consumers to protect themselves against emerging digital threats. You will be at the forefront of building AI-driven tools to detect and prevent scams across digital channels, making a meaningful difference in consumers' lives.

This is based in United States as a remote position. We will only consider candidates currently in The United States and are not offering relocation assistance at this time.
Job Description:

About the role:
• Product Strategy & Vision: Define and drive the product strategy and vision for GenAI-based scam detection solutions targeting the consumer segment. Identify market opportunities and competitive threats to create a roadmap that delivers innovative security solutions.
• Cross-Functional Leadership: Lead and collaborate with engineering, design, data science, marketing, and other teams in a complex cross-functional environment. Ensure alignment and clear communication of goals, priorities, and timelines across all stakeholders.
• Ambiguity Management: Thrive in and bring structure to ambiguous environments. Use your problem-solving skills and creativity to make informed decisions and define requirements with limited information.
• Execution & Delivery: Oversee product development, from ideation to launch, ensuring that projects are delivered on time and meet the highest quality standards. Continuously iterate on products based on user feedback, market trends, and data insights.
• Stakeholder Management: Present strategies, product updates, and performance insights to senior leadership. Demonstrate the confidence and analytical rigor to advocate for product decisions and pivot when necessary.
• User-Centric Mindset: Develop a deep understanding of user needs, behaviors, and pain points. Incorporate consumer feedback and usability studies to prioritize features and improve the overall user experience.
• Market Analysis: Stay ahead of the curve by conducting ongoing research on the cybersecurity and scam prevention landscape, competitor offerings, and emerging technologies. Use this knowledge to identify new opportunities and maintain a competitive edge.

About you:
• 10+ years of product management experience, preferably in the consumer tech or cybersecurity space. Proven track record of building successful B2C products from concept to launch
• Understanding of AI/ML technologies like Large Language Models (LLM), Multimodal Generative AI models, Natural Language Inference (NLI), Multiclass classification.
• Experience with GenAI applications preferred
• Strong mindset of multi-platform product development with a user-first mindset
• Experience in consumer security products or a related industry is highly desirable.
• Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on product analytics, user insights, and business metrics to inform decisions and strategy.
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Ability to clearly articulate complex ideas and strategies to both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Self-motivated, proactive, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

#LI-Remote

Accommodations:

McAfee recognizes and supports its obligation to reasonably accommodate applicants and employees with disabilities. We are here to help. Please let us know if you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application, interviewing, hiring, or at any other time during the employment process. Please do not include personal medical information in the email.

Diversity is foundational for our business success. We want to be a workplace of choice for all people and we value the unique perspectives offered by a diverse workforce. McAfee does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, age, ancestry, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy, or any other legally protected status. This principle applies to all areas of employment: recruitment and hiring, training, performance evaluations, promotions and transfers, compensation and benefits, and social and recreational programs.

McAfee desires to be an employer of choice with an inclusive environment for all individuals. As part of this goal and in compliance with various laws and regulations, McAfee provides reasonable accommodation to applicants and employees. Requests for reasonable accommodation for applicants and employees are evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

Posting Statement:

McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

The starting pay range for this position is $123,650.00-$203,150.00. McAfee takes into consideration an individual’s skillset, experience and location in making final salary determinations. For further details, please discuss with the Talent Acquisition Partner.

job_data.title: AI/ML Software Product Manager (ROCm)
job_data.description:
WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

THE ROLE:

Help us define the future for AI/ML practitioners. You will be responsible for understanding and defining requirements for markets leveraging AI/ML/Compute technologies, and working within the organization to deliver those solutions.

THE PERSON:

As the successful candidate, you will have a Product Management background with a history of working with AI/ML applications and workloads. You can demonstrate experience in software development organization, and a solid understanding of computing platforms for AI/ML practitioners and developers.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Product Management of AMD Software for AI/ML practitioners and developers, and new software solutions addressing this market
• Driving Software Roadmap based on strategic planning, requirements identification and competitive analysis
• Manage inputs to Engineering facing teams for effective delivery of end user solutions
• Detailing marketing requirements and use cases
• Positioning and messaging of solutions
• Encourage teams to meet aggressive deadlines on incredible products
• Lead business processes to funnel requirements to engineering facing teams
• Direct and indirect communications with OEM customers, ISVs, and internal teams regarding feature requirements & schedules, issue resolution and mitigation commitments
• Participate in conference calls with key customers
• Ability to evangelize solutions to large and small audiences

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
• Solid understanding of AI/ML practitioner and developer needs, the dominant trends in this market, the competitive landscape, what matters most to developers of these solutions, and which needs are going unmet
• Extensive experience working in technology with development teams delivering products
• Ability to demonstrate product management experience, specifically, the development, communication, and implementation of product plans
• Comfortable making regular presentations to senior leadership
• Ability to work well with internal and external engineering teams to develop practical solutions to challenging technical problems
• Detail oriented, organized, and capable of multi-tasking in a fast paced environment
• Experience providing support as needed to sales and marketing organizations

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
• Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Master's preferred

#LI-TB1

#LI-Hybrid

Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance.

AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

job_data.title: Product Manager - AI/ML
job_data.description:
About Versapay \uD83D\uDE80

For growing businesses that need to accomplish more with less, Versapay’s Accounts Receivable Efficiency Suite simplifies the invoice-to-cash process by automating invoicing, facilitating B2B payments, and streamlining cash application with AI. Versapay integrates natively with top ERPs, while allowing businesses to collect with a self-serve payment portal and collaborate with customers and teammates to resolve what automation alone can’t. Owned by Great Hill Partners, Versapay’s employee base spans the U.S. and Canada with offices in Atlanta and Miami. With 10,000 customers and 5M+ companies transacting, Versapay facilitates 110M+ transactions and $170B+ in payments volume annually

Think you might be the next Veep to join? Read on!!

Our Values
• ️ We obsess over our customers.
• ️ We help each other.
• ️ We embrace diversity.
• ️ We find better ways.
• ️ We get things done.
• ️ We own it.

How you’ll make a big impact here – and on your career:

Product management at Versapay is a craft that requires reimaging the status quo, finding ways to create value, and driving innovative experiences for clients and their customers through technology.

We are seeking an experienced AI/ML Product Manager to join the Versapay product management team. This role will be responsible for creating intelligence experiences on our platforms that serve our customers, their customers and Versapay employees.

The Ideal candidate has a proven track record of creating and launching products leveraging machine learning solutions that impact business customer experience at scale. Responsibilities include designing strategies for recommendation algorithms and applications that create value for its users. This is a very exciting opportunity to share the future of how customers will efficiently conduct invoice-to-cash journeys across the platforms.

You will manage products end-to-end, from early-stage research and ideation, through to implementation and improvement over time. Your impact will be measured by key commercial and customer success metrics. You will be responsible for leading a cross-functional group of engineering, design, and go-to-market team members to meet the needs of our customers and our business.

This role is designed to drive change, both in buyer behavior and operational processes, which means that a great candidate remains effective while being flexible and agile. You’ll use your intellectual curiosity, passion for product and bias toward action to steer strategy.

What you'll do:
• In this role, you will be responsible for iterating existing experiences, driving data-led experiments and delivering brand-new products. We want to find someone who is curious, can learn quickly, think creatively, and work collaboratively.
• Unify product strategy: Set the vision and direction for the product. Identify opportunities for cross-product collaboration, standardization and unification of various product lines and execute on agreed-upon strategies
• Identify progressive product features leveraging forward thinking technology, data, and tools, including ML or AI, that will provide a significantly differentiated value to the Versapay network suppliers and buyers helping them to drive significant efficiencies in accounts receivables
• Own the Product Development Life Cycle: Lead product end-to-end as part of dedicated squads throughout the entire development cycle, including top-end discovery and go-to-market.
• Be the expert on the product and customer: Know the product inside and out and understand who is using it and what they need to accomplish. Participate in market and technical design sessions, prototypes, and iteration planning meetings to build a product high in utility and adoption.
• Partner across teams: Leads agile cadences with designers and engineers to ensure alignment and prioritization. Collaborate with Marketing, Professional Services, Sales, and Success leaders to clearly define and develop the product’s value proposition and utilization across the organization.
• Conduct in-depth market research and user analysis to identify opportunities for payments products. Design hypotheses and effective experiments to test and learn.
• Operate in a complex cross-functional environment, leading and influencing others, ultimately resulting in timely tactical decision making to advance our objectives.
• Drive progress:Lead the development process from ideation to launch, including requirement gathering, technical specifications, user testing, and launch strategy. Define and prioritize the product/feature backlog, develop epics, and write user stories. Create customer facing and internal documents, presentations, articles, and training. Facilitate launch, adoption, and success of product go-to-market plans.

What you'll bring to the team:
• 5-7+ years of proven experience in product management, preferably with direct exposure or ownership of translating the business strategy to AI/ML and generative AI products
• A solid grasp of artificial intelligence, machine learning and related technologies is crucial to this role
• Must have strong familiarity with data science principles and practices. Ideal candidate has hands on experience AI/ML frameworks and tools, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Savvi AI, Sagemaker.
• 4+ years working with cross functional teams as a product owner in an agile development process.
• Exhibits a “fail fast” mentality using different types of experiments and research frameworks and testing
• Experience with the following: Jira, SQL, Product Analytics tools (like Heap, Mixpanel, and/or Amplitude)
• Proven track record of successfully launching and managing payments products in a competitive environment. Built APIs, products and complex systems at scale.
• “Builder” Mentality: Entrepreneurial and scrappy mindset. Ability to thrive in ambiguous environments with a track record of defining and executing net new initiatives. A desire to solve problems with no obvious path forward.
• Excellent communication skills to articulate complex AI and data concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Strong ability to present to C-level leadership and managing stakeholders.
• Possess deep analytics thinking and proven ability to interpret information to inform decision-making
• Bachelor's Degree in related field and/or relevant professional experience

What will make you stand out:
• Experience with Invoice to Cash processes in a Business-to-Business (B2B) setting, particularly AR billing, treasury and banking services.
• Experience with Fintech or Payments
• Technical understanding of payment frameworks
• Ability to connect to databases to inspect/change data

#LI-Remote

All of our Veeps live out our core values:

We look for excellence: individuals that are better than we are and not only meet our values but bring value to our teams.

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. Think you have what it takes, but not sure you check every box? Apply to the role anyways. We’d love to talk and determine together whether you could be a great fit!

We are committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. Versapay is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are addressed.
