job_data.title: Development Manager, AI Product
job_data.description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

We are seeking a Development Manager to join our growing Engineering team. This role is perfect for a leader who is passionate about AI-driven innovation, enjoys empowering teams, and thrives on delivering impactful solutions. As a leader within Clio’s AI group, you will help prioritize efforts to deliver on the overarching AI strategy, execute on integrating AI solutions with Clio’s core products, and develop high performing teams, while helping transform the legal experience for our customers through cutting-edge technology.

Clio is on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. Our AI team leverages NLP, GenAI, and other advanced ML technologies to deliver solutions that enhance productivity and streamline workflows for legal professionals. As a Development Manager, you will play a key role in shaping and executing this vision.

This role is available to candidates across Canada (excluding Quebec). If you are local to one of our hubs (Burnaby, Calgary, or Toronto) you will be expected to be in office minimum once per week on one of our Anchor Days.

What You’ll Do:
• Lead a high-performing team: Oversee a team of engineers and MLOps specialists, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning
• Prioritize work for strategic initiatives: Help define and execute the team’s roadmap, aligning ML solutions with Clio’s broader AI strategy and business goals
• Deliver impactful solutions: Ensure the successful design, development, and integration of ML models into Clio’s core product to enhance customer experiences
• Collaborate cross-functionally: Work closely with ML engineers and MLOps engineers, product management and design, and data teams across Clio to deliver end-to-end solutions
• Mentor and develop talent: Support the professional growth of your team through coaching, feedback, and development plans
• Promote engineering excellence: Uphold high standards for software development, including best practices in coding, testing, and deployment

Who You Are:
• Technical expertise: A strong background in software development and architecture, with hands-on experience in SaaS products
• Leadership experience: Proven ability to lead and grow teams, foster a collaborative culture, and inspire others to achieve their best work
• Strategic mindset: Ability to align technical initiatives with business objectives and prioritize effectively
• Collaboration skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a track record of building high-trust relationships across teams
• Problem-solving abilities: A creative and analytical approach to solving complex technical and business challenges

Bonus Points For:
• Experience collaborating with AI/ML teams in a SaaS or product-focused environment
• Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and AI/ML tools
• Understanding of legal tech and the unique challenges faced by legal professionals

#LI-Remote

What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio’s Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:
• Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
• Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office min. once per week on our Anchor Day.
• Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
• $2000 annual counseling benefit
• RRSP matching and RESP contribution
• Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years​

The full salary range* for this role is $167,000 to $208,800 to $250,600 CAD.Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.
• We aim to hire all candidates between the minimum and the midpoint of the full salary range. We reserve the midpoint to the maximum of the salary band for internal employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on individual experience and skillset of the candidate. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

job_data.title: AI Product Manager (The AI Visionary)
job_data.description:
Are you passionate about building products powered by artificial intelligence that solve real-world problems? Do you thrive on the challenge of turning cutting-edge AI technologies into user-centric products that drive business outcomes and enhance customer experiences? If you’re excited about leading AI-driven product innovation and want to shape the future of technology, then our client has the perfect role for you. We’re looking for an AI Product Manager (aka The AI Visionary) to lead the development and execution of AI-powered products that transform industries.

As an AI Product Manager at our client, you’ll work at the intersection of AI technology and product development, collaborating closely with data scientists, engineers, and business teams to bring AI-based products from concept to market. Your role will involve crafting the product vision, defining requirements, and ensuring that AI solutions meet user needs and align with the company’s strategic goals.

Key Responsibilities:
• Define Product Vision and Strategy:
• Develop and articulate the product vision for AI-driven solutions, aligning it with business objectives and market opportunities. You’ll own the product roadmap, ensuring that AI features and capabilities deliver high value to customers.
• Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams:
• Work closely with data scientists, machine learning engineers, UX designers, and business stakeholders to define product requirements, prioritize features, and ensure smooth collaboration across teams. You’ll guide teams to deliver AI solutions that are practical, scalable, and impactful.
• AI Product Lifecycle Management:
• Lead the full lifecycle of AI product development, from ideation and concept validation to launch and iteration. You’ll define key performance metrics (KPIs) and ensure that the product meets business and customer goals at every stage of its lifecycle.
• Translate AI Capabilities into User Benefits:
• Bridge the gap between complex AI technologies and end-user needs by translating technical capabilities into clear product benefits. You’ll work to ensure that the AI models, algorithms, and solutions deliver meaningful results for users.
• Market Research and User Feedback:
• Conduct market research and gather user feedback to identify unmet needs and opportunities for AI-powered innovation. You’ll ensure that the product roadmap is informed by data-driven insights, competitive analysis, and customer feedback.
• Oversee Product Launch and Go-to-Market Strategies:
• Work with marketing, sales, and customer success teams to plan and execute successful product launches. You’ll craft go-to-market strategies, create compelling messaging around AI-driven features, and ensure alignment with customer expectations.
• Monitor and Optimize Product Performance:
• Continuously monitor product performance, gathering data to understand how users interact with AI features. You’ll use this data to identify areas for improvement and ensure that products are delivering on their promises, optimizing them based on real-world feedback.

Requirements

Required Skills:
• AI and Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of AI and machine learning principles, including natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, and predictive analytics. You can translate complex AI concepts into actionable product strategies.
• Product Management Expertise: Proven experience in product management, with a track record of taking AI or data-driven products from concept to launch. You’re skilled at creating product roadmaps, defining requirements, and managing cross-functional teams.
• Data-Driven Decision Making: Ability to leverage data and user feedback to inform product development decisions. You’re comfortable using data to define product KPIs and to optimize product performance post-launch.
• Collaboration and Leadership: Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders. You’re skilled at balancing priorities and managing expectations across different functions.
• Market Research and Customer Focus: Experience in conducting market research, competitive analysis, and user testing to drive product innovation. You have a user-centered approach and prioritize features that meet customer needs and add value.

Educational Requirements:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business, or a related field. Equivalent experience in AI product management or related disciplines is also highly valued.
• Certifications or additional coursework in AI, machine learning, or product management are a plus.

Experience Requirements:
• 3+ years of experience in product management, with hands-on experience managing AI or machine learning products.
• Proven track record of leading cross-functional teams and successfully launching AI-powered products in production environments.
• Experience working with cloud-based AI platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is highly desirable.

Benefits
• Health and Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans with low co-pays and premiums.
• Paid Time Off: Competitive vacation, sick leave, and 20 paid holidays per year.
• Work-Life Balance: Flexible work schedules and telecommuting options.
• Professional Development: Opportunities for training, certification reimbursement, and career advancement programs.
• Wellness Programs: Access to wellness programs, including gym memberships, health screenings, and mental health resources.
• Life and Disability Insurance: Life insurance and short-term/long-term disability coverage.
• Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Confidential counseling and support services for personal and professional challenges.
• Tuition Reimbursement: Financial assistance for continuing education and professional development.
• Community Engagement: Opportunities to participate in community service and volunteer activities.
• Recognition Programs: Employee recognition programs to celebrate achievements and milestones.

job_data.title: Lead Product Manager, Artificial Intelligence
job_data.description:
Rapid7's AI Centre of Excellence

The AI CoE partners with cross-functional teams at Rapid7 to enable customers to assess risk, detect threats and automate their security programs. We ensure AI, ML and data science are applied in a meaningful way to add impactful value, best achieve business objectives and deliver ROI to both Rapid7 and our customers. We adopt a creative, fast-fail, highly iterative approach to accelerate ideas from proof-of-concept to go or no-go. Our current capabilities are built on 20+ years of threat analysis and open-source communities with 40 AI patents granted and 20+ pending. Our AI goals are ambitious and we need dynamic people with a desire to be part of something big.

About the Role

Rapid7 is making significant investments in our AI Centre of Excellence, encompassing the full range of AI, ML and data science. As a leader in cybersecurity, we're on a mission to incorporate AI throughout our platform portfolio and optimize our customers to Take Command of the Attack Surface.

We're seeking an experienced AI-focused product manager to lead identifying, defining, and delivering large scale, enterprise grade solutions to both delight our customers and deliver value across multiple products within the Rapid7 portfolio. You'll be primarily responsible for managing the entire product lifecycle; partnering with data scientists, engineers, UI/UX, customer researchers, technical writers, marketing, and compliance and governance teams to do so. Our teams utilize generative AI, neural networks, and more conventional data science so prior experience is a must to be able to make an impact immediately!

Responsibilities of Role:
• Partner with cross-functional leadership teams to own the AI product vision across the Rapid7 product portfolio; including communication with internal and external teams of varying business levels
• Partner with customer research, UX, data science, product and engineering teams to ensure we create the best AI products and experiences that maximize customer and business impact
• Ensure product development alignment with Rapid7's compliance and governance policies
• Manage multiple AI initiatives and product life cycles that map to Rapid7's business objectives and product strategy
• Work closely with AI engineers on defining potential use cases for R&D, tailoring AI-based approaches for most suitable solutions that meet customer, company, and market requirements
• Define, design, and lead execution of user requirements into AI-based product deliverables, partnering with multiple teams through the Rapid7 product SDLC processes
• Facilitate cross-functional collaboration and understanding of initiatives, customer outcomes, and urgency to mitigate risks in dependencies for deliverables
• Create and report upon KPIs and metrics to monitor cost, usage, and customer adoption appropriate through varying stages of development; from POC to full production releases
• Collaborate with AI CoE and Marketing on messaging and artifacts for public visibility of AI-based initiatives, development, and customer engagement
• Lead, coach, and mentor colleagues through influence; positively contributing to our product culture in a highly complex and fast-changing environment

What we're looking for:
• 6+ years in product management, with experience equivalent to Lead/Principal level roles
• Demonstrated knowledge of AI/ML concepts, markets, and practices and an eagerness to stay up-to-date on emerging policies, trends, and competitors
• Ability to articulate and understand unique complexities of AI-based initiatives; through initial research, higher degrees of prototyping, iterative experiments and evaluations, deployment and continuous monitoring
• Fluency in driving the complete product lifecycle, having operated in the unique space of AI with an excellent understanding of how to map use-cases to AI solutions and concepts
• Ideally, experience in cybersecurity or security operations centers, but not mandatory
• A fast learner with an open-mind to accept, seek and consider opinions from a wide range of stakeholders
• Superb communication abilities that adjust based on the levels of seniority in the business
• A track record of successfully positioning products and their features within a highly competitive landscape

We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. That's because these teams reflect a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don't be shy - apply today.

About Rapid7

At Rapid7, we are on a mission to create a secure digital world for our customers, our industry, and our communities. We do this by embracing tenacity, passion, and collaboration to challenge what's possible and drive extraordinary impact.

Here, we're building a dynamic workplace where everyone can have the career experience of a lifetime. We challenge ourselves to grow to our full potential. We learn from our missteps and celebrate our victories. We come to work every day to push boundaries in cybersecurity and keep our 11,000+ global customers ahead of whatever's next.

Join us and bring your unique experiences and perspectives to tackle some of the world's biggest security challenges.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state or local law.

job_data.title: Product Manager, Responsible AI
job_data.description:
At GSK, we are using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to develop new therapies and personalized drugs that drive better outcomes for patients. Because the datasets we use and algorithms we build at each step of the drug development journey have ethical and safety implications for our patients, GSK has a dedicated team working on the responsible use of AI in healthcare, establishing a robust responsible AI framework to guide our use of AIML. To help inform these efforts, GSK actively pursues applied ethics and safety research projects within the company, as well as sponsoring AI ethics and safety fellows at Stanford and the University of Adelaide. Our Responsible AI team delivers innovative engineering, policy, and governance work to facilitate the responsible adoption of AI at GSK.

We are looking for a Product Manager that can help to lead the development of projects in Responsible AI. With the autonomy to drive every stage of the product lifecycle, you'll collaborate with top-tier internal and external teams to bring innovative ideas to life.

In this role you will
• Shape the Future: Drive the vision and strategy for AI products that tackle complex challenges with innovative solutions.
• Leverage Cutting-Edge Tech: Work at the intersection of science and AI, utilizing GSK's extensive data to enhance patient outcomes.
• Collaborate and Innovate: Partner with cross-functional teams and senior leaders to turn ideas into impactful products.
• Thrive in an Agile Environment: Bring your ideas to life in a culture that values agility, continuous learning, and rapid iteration.
• Building Responsibly: Work at the forefront of AI ethics to create impactful and responsible products.

Your Impact
• Define and Execute: Set clear objectives for AI products, ensuring alignment with GSK's broader strategy and successful execution.
• Lead with Expertise: Apply your deep knowledge of AI and data to drive product development.
• Champion Customers: Be the voice of the user, ensuring their needs shape every stage of development.
• Manage Data and Risk: Oversee data requirements, manage the AI Risk register, and ensure compliance with GSK's data governance standards.
• Embrace Agile: Lead iterative development with a focus on continuous improvement and delivering tangible results.
• Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Engage experts from a range of fields to build truly interdisciplinary products.

Why you?

Qualifications & Skills:

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
• Experience in product management or similar role, preferably with a focus on AI/ML or related technology.
• Strong understanding of data and software engineering processes.
• Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage complex projects.
• Experience in applying Agile methodologies for product development.
• Excellent decision-making skills, balancing pace, rigor, and risk effectively.
• A keen interest in the responsible development of AI.

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
• Advanced degree in Chemistry, Biology, Physics, or a related quantitative field.
• Demonstrated ability to influence and negotiate across different management levels.
• Experience in organizing and motivating cross-departmental teams.
• Proven track record in process improvement and change management within the product lifecycle.

Closing Date for Applications: Sunday 5th January 2024 (COB)

Due to the holiday period, we have an extended closing date for this role; and expect to start interviewing mid-January. Therefore, there will be a delay in receiving a response/update to your application.

Expected timeline: I aim to provide an update on your application between the 6th &10th January 2025

Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert.
When applying for this role, please use the 'cover letter' of the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application.

During the course of your application, you will be requested to complete voluntary information which will be used in monitoring the effectiveness of our equality and diversity policies. Your information will be treated as confidential and will not be used in any part of the selection process. If you require a reasonable adjustment to the application / selection process to enable you to demonstrate your ability to perform the job requirements, please contact 0808 234 4391. This will help us to understand any modifications we may need to make to support you throughout our selection process.

#LI-GSK

Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose - to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together - so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns - as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it's also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves - feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are open to all talent. In the US, we also adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to neurodiversity, race/ethnicity, colour, national origin, religion, gender, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class*(*US only).

We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on Ukdiversity.recruitment@gsk.com or 0808 234 4391. The helpline is available from 8.30am to 12.00 noon Monday to Friday, during bank holidays these times and days may vary.

Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments, we will not be able to support you through these channels. However, we have created a UK Recruitment FAQ guide. Click the link and scroll to the Careers Section where you will find answers to multiple questions we receive .

As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it.Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK's compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK's Transparency ReportingFor the Record site.

job_data.title: Staff Product Manager, AI
job_data.description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a pioneer in legal technology with a mission to transform the legal experience for all. At Clio, you will have the unique opportunity to shape the future of legal technology, leveraging the momentum of our explosive growth and our position as a leader in the industry. With our recent valuation of $3B, Clio is the global operating system for law firms, empowering over 150,000 legal professionals across 130 countries. Our AI investments are at the forefront of our product innovation, supported by a world-class team of machine learning engineers, product designers and managers, who are pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in legal tech. We are bettering the lives of legal professionals with technology solutions that make legal work more efficient, seamless, and effective, contributing towards increased access to justice

Summary:

As the Staff Product Manager for AI, your role will be pivotal in defining and executing AI strategies that fuel Clio’s continued growth and cement our leadership in the legal technology space. You’ll lead the charge in creating AI-driven products and features that simplify complex legal workflows, improve productivity, and unlock transformative insights for legal professionals. With the backing of a fast-growing, high-performing team and a strong hold on the legal market, this is your chance to make an outsized impact in an industry undergoing rapid digital transformation.

This role can be performed from one of our Canadian offices, or remotely from the US or Canada or a combination of both. Some exceptions may apply.

What You’ll Do

Define and Execute AI Product Strategy
• Own the vision, strategy, and roadmap for AI-powered products and features, aligning them with Clio’s overall business goals.
• Translate complex AI capabilities into intuitive, high-value solutions for legal professionals, enhancing productivity, accuracy, and client outcomes.
• Collaborate with engineering, data science, design, and legal experts to deliver domain-specific AI solutions that solve pressing industry challenges.

Deliver Measurable Impact
• Drive adoption of AI features across Clio’s products by identifying clear customer use cases and integrating them into existing workflows.
• Develop metrics to measure the success of AI capabilities, such as improvements in efficiency, user adoption, and retention.
• Create processes to ensure continuous learning and iteration, leveraging feedback and data to improve performance.

Collaborate Across Teams
• Partner with cross-functional teams to integrate AI seamlessly into Clio’s core platform, including features like document generation, legal chat assistant, recommendation engines, marketing automation, auto timetracking, hybrid search, RAG, predictive analytics, and more.
• Work closely with leadership to align AI priorities with company goals and communicate product successes and opportunities.
• Engage with external stakeholders, including legal professionals and industry experts, to refine use cases and validate product-market fit.

Lead the 0-to-1 Development of AI Initiatives
• Take AI projects from concept to scale, focusing on key outcomes like enhancing legal workflows and enabling predictive decision-making.
• Guide the development of AI-powered capabilities that deliver a competitive edge while maintaining high standards for privacy, security, and compliance.

Experience And Skills
• 8+ years of product management experience, with 5+ years in AI/ML-based products.
• Proven track record of delivering AI features that incorporate technologies such as LLMs, NLP, generative AI, and predictive analytics.
• Strong understanding of the AI product lifecycle, including ideation, prototyping, production deployment, and monitoring.
• Exceptional Analytical Skills: Proven ability to synthesize complex data and translate it into actionable product strategies and priorities.
• Critical Thinking: Adept at identifying underlying problems and opportunities, even in ambiguous or rapidly evolving scenarios, and framing them in a structured, actionable way.
• Data-Driven Decision Making: Expertise in leveraging data to validate hypotheses, measure success, and inform product direction.
• Market Analysis: Deep understanding of AI industry trends, competitive landscapes, and emerging technologies to ensure Clio remains at the forefront of innovation.

Strategic Leadership
• Demonstrated ability to align AI initiatives with broader company objectives, balancing technical possibilities with customer impact.
• A strategic thinker with a customer-first mindset, capable of identifying opportunities where AI can deliver measurable value.
• Experience working with cross-functional teams and leading through influence in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
• Strategic Prioritization: Ability to balance short-term deliverables with long-term strategic goals, ensuring alignment with Clio’s mission and objectives.

Mindset and Approach
• Curious and adaptable, with a willingness to navigate ambiguity and drive clarity in complex projects.
• Strong communication skills, capable of simplifying technical concepts for diverse audiences, including executives, engineers, and customers.
• Passionate about leveraging AI to solve real-world problems, with a deep commitment to improving legal workflows and access to justice.

Bonus points if you have:

Legal Tech Acumen:
• Strong understanding of legal tech trends, compliance standards, and industry regulations.
• Ability to bridge the gap between legal requirements and technological solutions.

Product at Clio

Our market opportunity is rare in its scale and powered by a strong business model, world-class investors and advisors and a product management team which is global and world-class (if we do say so ourselves)! Clio is growing rapidly with massive growth opportunities for Product Managers.

Speaking of product at Clio… we’ve worked hard to develop an excellent product management culture with empowered PMs who are highly regarded and influential within the organization. Our team is composed of seasoned professionals from a diverse set of product backgrounds. Clio invests heavily in developing Product Managers, growing leaders and in the broader Product communities in which we operate.

We pride ourselves on being ‘human and high performing’ and creating a workplace where you can be challenged, supported and bring your whole self to work.

What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio’s Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:
• Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
• Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office min. once per week on our Anchor Day.
• Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
• $2000 annual counseling benefit
• RRSP matching and RESP contribution
• Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years

The full salary range* for this role is $152,100 to $190,100 to $228,100 CAD..
• We aim to hire all candidates between the minimum and the midpoint of the full salary range. We reserve the midpoint to the maximum of the salary band for internal employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on individual experience and skillset of the candidate. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

job_data.title: Decision Automation Product Manager
job_data.via: Define Your Career With IBM | Careers - IBM
job_data.description:
Introduction
A career in IBM Software means you’ll be part of a team that transforms our customer’s challenges into industry-leading solutions.

We are an infinitely curious team, always seeking new possibilities, and dedicated to creating the world’s leading AI-powered, cloud-native software solutions. Our renowned legacy creates endless global opportunities for our network of IBMers. We are a team of deep product experts, ensuring exceptional client experiences, with a focus on delivery, excellence, and obsession over customer outcomes.

IBM’s product and technology landscape includes Research, Software, and Infrastructure. Entering this domain positions you at the heart of IBM, where growth and innovation thrive.

Your Role and Responsibilities
At IBM, we empower businesses to make smarter, faster decisions through our webMethods platform, enabling rule-driven automation and decision-making at scale. We are seeking an innovative and results-oriented Product Manager to lead the evolution of webMethods Business Rules within our portfolio of decision automation solutions.

The ideal candidate will bring a deep understanding of business rules management and a passion for delivering intuitive, high-impact solutions that drive business outcomes. In this role, you will collaborate with global teams across engineering, design, sales, marketing, and customer success to deliver innovative features and capabilities that meet customer needs and advance IBM’s leadership in decision automation.

What You’ll Do:

Lead Product Strategy:
• Define and execute the product strategy and roadmap for webMethods Business Rules, ensuring alignment with market trends, customer feedback, and IBM’s business goals.
• Conduct customer discovery sessions and market research to identify pain points, opportunities for innovation, and new use cases for business rules.

Drive Development and Delivery:
• Work with engineering and design teams to translate strategy into prioritized, well-defined product requirements.
• Participate in the product development lifecycle, from concept and design through implementation, testing, and release.

Enable Customer Success:
• Act as a trusted advisor to customers, partners, and internal stakeholders, helping them understand the value of webMethods Business Rules and how it meets their business needs.
• Develop and maintain performance benchmarks, monitor feature usage, and evaluate customer feedback to continuously improve product quality and outcomes.

Collaborate Across Teams:
• Interface with stakeholders across sales, customer success, and marketing to clarify product capabilities, gather insights, and ensure consistent messaging.
• Partner with global teams to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions that meet performance, response time, and scalability requirements.

Stay Ahead of the Curve:
• Maintain a current understanding of industry and technology trends in decision automation, business rules management, and adjacent fields.
• Use market insights to identify opportunities for differentiation and competitive advantage.

What You’ll Bring:

Customer-Centric Mindset:
• A strong focus on delivering business value through customer-centric decision-making.
• The ability to effectively communicate with technical and business stakeholders to bridge gaps and ensure alignment.

Technical Expertise:
• Proven ability to work with highly technical customers, enterprise-scale environments, and cross-functional development teams in agile settings.
• Hands-on knowledge of webMethods Business Rules platform features and functionality is a plus.

Collaborative Leadership:
• Experience working with sales and sales engineering teams to deliver value to customers.
• The ability to inspire and lead cross-functional teams to achieve strategic business goals.

Analytical Skills:
• Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with the ability to use data and metrics to make informed decisions and measure success.
• A proactive approach to solving ambiguous and open-ended problems.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
• Minimum 5 years of experience in technical software product management or equivalent developer experience.
• Demonstrated expertise in business rules management systems (BRMS) and decision automation.
• Familiarity with webMethods technologies, including Integration Server, Designer, and related platforms.
• Experience with SOAP/RESTful APIs, SQL development, and integrating web applications with ERP/Legacy platforms.
• Strong communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills to work effectively across diverse teams.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
• Growth mindset with a drive to innovate and deliver exceptional outcomes.
• Experience with large enterprise customers and managing stakeholder relationships.
• Hands-on experience with SaaS, application integration, or iPaaS solutions.
• Familiarity with agile development practices and tools such as GitHub and Aha!.

job_data.title: Senior AI Product Manager
job_data.description:
Why would you love this job?

As an AI Product Manager focusing on Inference Caching & Routing, you will play an integral role in driving the lifecycle of Redis’ AI capabilities, part of the world's number one real-time database platform. You will be at the forefront of innovation, helping to shape the future of AI applications by optimizing performance and reducing costs for customers in Generative AI through advanced caching and routing products.

What you’ll do:
• Define Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and strategy for inference caching and routing, aligning with Redis’ overall AI strategy.
• Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with architects, engineers, and other internal and external stakeholders to define and write detailed product requirements.
• Manage Product Lifecycle: Maintain a backlog of features, manage priorities, and ensure execution to specifications—and on time in light of Redis strategy.
• Customer Interaction: Engage with customers and partners to understand their needs and gather feedback to inform product development.
• Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate on go-to-market strategies to ensure successful product launches and adoption.

What will you need to have?
• Experience: 5+ years of experience in software product management or equivalent experience in an enterprise organization.
• AI Domain Knowledge: Deep understanding of AI/ML concepts, including experience with machine learning tools such as LLMs, Generative AI frameworks like LangChain and vector databases
• Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills to articulate product vision and requirements to diverse teams.
• Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to make data-driven decisions.
• Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field.

Extra great if you have:
• Experience with Redis: Hands-on experience with Redis and its ecosystem.
• Open-Source Community: Active participation in the AI open-source community.
• Cloud-Native Applications: Experience architecting cloud-native applications.

We give back to our employees:

Our culture is what makes Redis a fun and rewarding place to work. To support you at work and beyond, we offer all our US team members fantastic benefits and perks:
• Competitive salaries and equity grants
• Unlimited time off to promote a healthy work-life balance
• Health, Dental, and Vision coverage along with 401K, FSA, and commuter benefits

#LI-Remote #LI-CA2

job_data.title: Senior Product Manager, Artificial Intelligence
job_data.description:
Rapid7’s AI Centre of Excellence

The AI CoE partners with cross-functional teams at Rapid7 to enable customers to assess risk, detect threats and automate their security programs. We ensure AI, ML and data science are applied in a meaningful way to add impactful value, best achieve business objectives and deliver ROI to both Rapid7 and our customers. We adopt a creative, fast-fail, highly iterative approach to accelerate ideas from proof-of-concept to go or no-go. Our current capabilities are built on 20+ years of threat analysis and open-source communities with 40 AI patents granted and 20+ pending. Our AI goals are ambitious and we need dynamic people with a desire to be part of something big.

About the Role

Rapid7 is making significant investments in our AI Centre of Excellence, encompassing the full range of AI, ML and data science. As a leader in cybersecurity, we’re on a mission to incorporate AI throughout our platform portfolio and optimize our customers to Take Command of the Attack Surface.

We’re seeking an experienced AI-focused product manager to lead identifying, defining, and delivering large scale, enterprise grade solutions to both delight our customers and deliver value across multiple products within the Rapid7 portfolio. You’ll be primarily responsible for managing the entire product lifecycle; partnering with data scientists, engineers, UI/UX, customer researchers, technical writers, marketing, and compliance and governance teams to do so. Our teams utilize generative AI, neural networks, and more conventional data science so prior experience is a must to be able to make an impact immediately!

Responsibilities of Role:
• Partner with cross-functional leadership teams to own the AI product vision across the Rapid7 product portfolio; including communication with internal and external teams of varying business levels
• Partner with customer research, UX, data science, product and engineering teams to ensure we create the best AI products and experiences that maximize customer and business impact
• Ensure product development alignment with Rapid7’s compliance and governance policies
• Manage multiple AI initiatives and product life cycles that map to Rapid7’s business objectives and product strategy
• Work closely with AI engineers on defining potential use cases for R&D, tailoring AI-based approaches for most suitable solutions that meet customer, company, and market requirements
• Define, design, and lead execution of user requirements into AI-based product deliverables, partnering with multiple teams through the Rapid7 product SDLC processes
• Facilitate cross-functional collaboration and understanding of initiatives, customer outcomes, and urgency to mitigate risks in dependencies for deliverables
• Create and report upon KPIs and metrics to monitor cost, usage, and customer adoption appropriate through varying stages of development; from POC to full production releases
• Collaborate with AI CoE and Marketing on messaging and artifacts for public visibility of AI-based initiatives, development, and customer engagement
• Lead, coach, and mentor colleagues through influence; positively contributing to our product culture in a highly complex and fast-changing environment

What we’re looking for:
• 4+ years in product management, with experience equivalent to Lead/Principal level roles
• Demonstrated knowledge of AI/ML concepts, markets, and practices and an eagerness to stay up-to-date on emerging policies, trends, and competitors
• Ability to articulate and understand unique complexities of AI-based initiatives; through initial research, higher degrees of prototyping, iterative experiments and evaluations, deployment and continuous monitoring
• Fluency in driving the complete product lifecycle, having operated in the unique space of AI with an excellent understanding of how to map use-cases to AI solutions and concepts
• Ideally, experience in cybersecurity or security operations centers, but not mandatory
• A fast learner with an open-mind to accept, seek and consider opinions from a wide range of stakeholders
• Superb communication abilities that adjust based on the levels of seniority in the business
• A track record of successfully positioning products and their features within a highly competitive landscape

We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. That’s because these teams reflect a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don’t be shy - apply today.

About Rapid7

At Rapid7, we are on a mission to create a secure digital world for our customers, our industry, and our communities. We do this by embracing tenacity, passion, and collaboration to challenge what’s possible and drive extraordinary impact.

Here, we’re building a dynamic workplace where everyone can have the career experience of a lifetime. We challenge ourselves to grow to our full potential. We learn from our missteps and celebrate our victories. We come to work every day to push boundaries in cybersecurity and keep our 11,000+ global customers ahead of whatever’s next.

Join us and bring your unique experiences and perspectives to tackle some of the world’s biggest security challenges.

#LI-WP1

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state or local law.

job_data.title: AI Product Manager (The AI Visionary)
job_data.description:
Are you passionate about building products powered by artificial intelligence that solve real-world problems? Do you thrive on the challenge of turning cutting-edge AI technologies into user-centric products that drive business outcomes and enhance customer experiences? If you're excited about leading AI-driven product innovation and want to shape the future of technology, then our client has the perfect role for you. We're looking for an AI Product Manager (aka The AI Visionary) to lead the development and execution of AI-powered products that transform industries.

As an AI Product Manager at our client, you'll work at the intersection of AI technology and product development, collaborating closely with data scientists, engineers, and business teams to bring AI-based products from concept to market. Your role will involve crafting the product vision, defining requirements, and ensuring that AI solutions meet user needs and align with the company's strategic goals.

Key Responsibilities:
• Define Product Vision and Strategy:
• Develop and articulate the product vision for AI-driven solutions, aligning it with business objectives and market opportunities. You'll own the product roadmap, ensuring that AI features and capabilities deliver high value to customers.
• Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams:
• Work closely with data scientists, machine learning engineers, UX designers, and business stakeholders to define product requirements, prioritize features, and ensure smooth collaboration across teams. You'll guide teams to deliver AI solutions that are practical, scalable, and impactful.
• AI Product Lifecycle Management:
• Lead the full lifecycle of AI product development, from ideation and concept validation to launch and iteration. You'll define key performance metrics (KPIs) and ensure that the product meets business and customer goals at every stage of its lifecycle.
• Translate AI Capabilities into User Benefits:
• Bridge the gap between complex AI technologies and end-user needs by translating technical capabilities into clear product benefits. You'll work to ensure that the AI models, algorithms, and solutions deliver meaningful results for users.
• Market Research and User Feedback:
• Conduct market research and gather user feedback to identify unmet needs and opportunities for AI-powered innovation. You'll ensure that the product roadmap is informed by data-driven insights, competitive analysis, and customer feedback.
• Oversee Product Launch and Go-to-Market Strategies:
• Work with marketing, sales, and customer success teams to plan and execute successful product launches. You'll craft go-to-market strategies, create compelling messaging around AI-driven features, and ensure alignment with customer expectations.
• Monitor and Optimize Product Performance:
• Continuously monitor product performance, gathering data to understand how users interact with AI features. You'll use this data to identify areas for improvement and ensure that products are delivering on their promises, optimizing them based on real-world feedback.

Requirements

Required Skills:
• AI and Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of AI and machine learning principles, including natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, and predictive analytics. You can translate complex AI concepts into actionable product strategies.
• Product Management Expertise: Proven experience in product management, with a track record of taking AI or data-driven products from concept to launch. You're skilled at creating product roadmaps, defining requirements, and managing cross-functional teams.
• Data-Driven Decision Making: Ability to leverage data and user feedback to inform product development decisions. You're comfortable using data to define product KPIs and to optimize product performance post-launch.
• Collaboration and Leadership: Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders. You're skilled at balancing priorities and managing expectations across different functions.
• Market Research and Customer Focus: Experience in conducting market research, competitive analysis, and user testing to drive product innovation. You have a user-centered approach and prioritize features that meet customer needs and add value.
Educational Requirements:
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business, or a related field. Equivalent experience in AI product management or related disciplines is also highly valued.
• Certifications or additional coursework in AI, machine learning, or product management are a plus.
Experience Requirements:
• 3+ years of experience in product management, with hands-on experience managing AI or machine learning products.
• Proven track record of leading cross-functional teams and successfully launching AI-powered products in production environments.
• Experience working with cloud-based AI platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is highly desirable.
Benefits
• Health and Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans with low co-pays and premiums.
• Paid Time Off: Competitive vacation, sick leave, and 20 paid holidays per year.
• Work-Life Balance: Flexible work schedules and telecommuting options.
• Professional Development: Opportunities for training, certification reimbursement, and career advancement programs.
• Wellness Programs: Access to wellness programs, including gym memberships, health screenings, and mental health resources.
• Life and Disability Insurance: Life insurance and short-term/long-term disability coverage.
• Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Confidential counseling and support services for personal and professional challenges.
• Tuition Reimbursement: Financial assistance for continuing education and professional development.
• Community Engagement: Opportunities to participate in community service and volunteer activities.
• Recognition Programs: Employee recognition programs to celebrate achievements and milestones.

job_data.title: Senior AI Product Manager (f/m/d)
job_data.description:
Your mission

DeepOpinion is the enterprise-grade Agentic Automation platform enabling teams to put their complex knowledge work on autopilot. By combining Agentic AI, business process digitization and no-code development in a single platform, teams can create AI apps in minutes to achieve 90%+ straight-through processing.

With €11 million raised in a Series A funding round co-led by Red River West and Alpha Intelligence Capital, and the support of existing investors Lunar Ventures and Stride VC, we are accelerating our vision to become the go-to provider for AI-driven automation solutions across the globe.

As a Senior AI Product Manager with a background in Machine Learning, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our product. The ideal candidate has worked in dynamic startup environments and is passionate about applying state-of-the-art AI research to real-world enterprise solutions. You will own the product roadmap, work closely with cross-functional teams, and drive the successful delivery of innovative solutions that meet the evolving needs of our customers. This role requires an understanding of automation/ AI technologies, market dynamics, and a customer-centric approach to product development.

Your responsibilities:
• Develop, manage, and communicate the product roadmap, ensuring it is aligned with customer needs, business goals, and the latest trends in automation and AI.
• Define and execute the product strategy and vision, aligning it with the company’s overall objectives and market needs.
• Oversee the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to launch to post-launch improvements.
• Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams to deliver high-quality products on time and within scope.
• Define and track key product performance metrics. Use data to drive decisions, improve product features, and optimize the user experience.
• Partner with marketing and sales teams to develop go-to-market strategies, including product positioning, messaging, and pricing.
• Stay at the cutting edge of automation and AI advancements by conducting continuous market research, competitive analysis, and tracking industry trends to ensure our products remain competitive and innovative.
• Utilize your previous experience working in high-growth, next-gen startups to bring agility, customer focus, and a strong execution mindset to the team.
• Stay informed about the latest state-of-the-art research in large language models and apply these findings to develop intelligent, automated solutions that address complex enterprise challenges.

Your profile
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field.
• 5+ years of product management experience, with a strong focus on Gen AI, LLM's, SaaS and/or AI-driven technologies.
• Strong experience in automation technologies (workflow automation, etc.) with an understanding of how these solutions solve enterprise problems.
• Demonstrated experience working in high-growth startups, particularly in the tech/AI space, with a keen understanding of agile development processes and startup challenges.
• Ability to manage complex product roadmaps and prioritize features based on business needs, customer value, and technical feasibility.
• Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders across various teams.
• Strong technical acumen, with an ability to understand complex technical concepts and communicate them to non-technical stakeholders.

What we offer
• Fast-paced, high-growth startup environment where your ideas matter, and every day is different.
• Work from anywhere that inspires you, location is not a barrier!
• Be among the first 50 to revolutionise industry standards. This is your chance to enter the big league and be part of the next unicorn.
• An opportunity to work with industry-leading AI solutions that are changing the way enterprises think about automation.
• A culture of innovation—we want you to push boundaries and test the limits of what’s possible.
• Competitive salaries and equity options, ensuring your hard work pays off.

Your Next Step Starts Here!
At DeepOpinion, it’s not just about the job—it’s about being part of a journey where innovation and growth go hand in hand. You’ll find yourself surrounded by a diverse team that includes top graduates from institutions like Cambridge, INSEAD, and Creative Destruction Lab, Forbes 30 Under 30s, and passionate individuals with unconventional backgrounds.

We value diversity and promote it through empathy and respect. We assess based on professional skills, not on social background, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, or skin colour.

job_data.title: Product Manager - Refinement Tools
job_data.description:
"The AI company that's revolutionizing Hollywood"

Flawless is shattering the boundaries of traditional filmmaking with its groundbreaking suite of Gen AI film editing tools. Our mission is to empower creators with cutting-edge technology that fosters creativity without compromise, broadens storytelling possibilities, and delivers unmatched visual and emotional impact. In tandem with these innovations, we’re setting new standards in ethical AI by developing the Artistic Rights Treasury (A.R.T.), a rights management solution that safeguards artists and rights holders across the entertainment industry.

Central to our efforts is our flagship Refinement product—an innovative solution that enables creative professionals to fine-tune outputs generated by our AI pipeline for post-production and localization. Unmatched in the market, Refinement pushes the boundaries of automated content adaptation, shaping the future of film and media creation.

Role reports to

Product Director - Steve Wozniak

What We Are Looking For

We’re seeking a Product Manager to own and execute the Refinement product roadmap. Reporting to the Product Director, you’ll translate strategy into actionable plans, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality features. This role is perfect for someone who’s passionate about learning and evolving—transforming breakthroughs in AI and production workflows into intuitive, future-ready tools that push creative boundaries. You’ll thrive if you love crafting intuitive visual experiences that enhance creative flexibility and set new industry standards. As you partner with engineering, design, AI/ML, production, and creative teams, you’ll prioritize initiatives, refine requirements, and leverage data and customer feedback to continually raise the bar. Your ultimate goal: empower creators, inspire innovation, and help elevate the art of visual storytelling.

Responsibilities
• Roadmap Execution: Drive the Refinement product roadmap, prioritizing initiatives that empower filmmakers and creatives to produce high-quality content at scale whilst delivering meaningful business value for Flawless
• Requirements & Delivery: Translate strategic goals into clear user stories and acceptance criteria, ensuring features meet the film industry’s high quality standards, integrate seamlessly with new AI modules, and ship on time.
• Customer Insight & Validation: Conduct user research and interviews with filmmakers, editors, and other industry professionals to validate assumptions and guide product decisions that address real-world production and post-production challenges.
• Data-Driven Improvements: Define success metrics, track performance across our creative workflows, and leverage data insights to refine AI-driven capabilities, improving both efficiency and visual quality.
• Stakeholder Alignment & Communication: Regularly update stakeholders on roadmap progress, proactively address challenges, and manage expectations.
• Market & Competitive Awareness: Stay informed about market trends and competitor offerings, using these insights to keep the roadmap relevant and differentiated.

Qualifications
• 5+ years of product management experience, ideally in a fast-paced, innovative setting.
• Demonstrated success driving complex products from conception to launch.
• A technical background or the ability to quickly grasp technical concepts is a plus.
• Proven ability to design outcome-based metrics and successfully align product strategies with business objectives.
• Exceptional communication, stakeholder management, and influence skills, with a track record of motivating cross-functional teams.
• Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities, with a keen understanding of how to derive meaningful insights from data.

Interview Process

At Flawless, our team and interview process want to help you show your best self. We’ll dive into past projects and simulate working together.

Our interview process is three rounds with some casual Zoom (or in-person) coffee in between to get to know each other:

Recruiting Screen: 30-45 minute call with our recruiting team (We want to discuss your interests and motivations as well as the practical details and make sure that Flawless would be a good fit for you)

Hiring Manager Screen: 45-60 minutes digging into your past experience. Primarily asking you to talk through your past work. We will want you to talk in depth about products you have worked and understand how you are able to evaluate them, think about how they might be improved and the different people you have worked with to build them

Team Interview: 1.5 hours onsite Interview where you will meet variety of your potential future colleagues. Here we will try to understand how you collaborate and work in XFN teams. We will also ask you to critically evaluate our existing product and use this as a base to explore how you think about products and problem solve.

Your Recruiter and hiring manager will be your main point of contact and prepare you for interviews. You’ll meet 4 to 6 people from across the business. (We make sure that you have time in each interview to ask them questions). If we don’t give an offer, we’ll provide feedback!

Why Join Us

You’ll be an integral part of a team pushing the boundaries of what's possible in AI-driven localization. We foster an environment based on trust, autonomy, and collaboration. Join Flawless and shape the future of a company that’s caring, creative, and truly collaborative. This is your opportunity to play a pivotal role in scaling a world-class product that revolutionizes how global audiences experience content.

In addition to this, you'll also receive:

Autonomy

A hybrid working environment

Competitive Salary

Stock Options

Flawless is proud to emphasize an equal opportunity, safe environment for people to do their best work. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

job_data.title: Artificial Intelligence Product Manager
job_data.description:
Who We Are:

Payments, Orchestrated.

Chattanooga-based Transcard offers comprehensive global payment orchestration solutions for banks, fintechs, and businesses. Our embedded payment solutions enable seamless transactions, collaboration, and data sharing with customers and suppliers worldwide. Features include disbursements, receivables, account-to-account payments, cross-border payments, AI insights, and supply chain financing.

Transcard’s solutions combine multi-rail capabilities, embedded workflows, system of record integration, effortless reconciliation, and bank-grade security to support B2B and B2C payments for businesses of all sizes. Streamline financial operations with digital payments, monitor real-time activity, reduce fraud risk, and improve customer and vendor experience with an all-in-one payment portal.

Position Details:

This is a full-time position, working Monday-Friday during standard business hours. Compensation will be based on the qualifications of applicant.

Location:

This is a Hybrid REMOTE/ONSITE opportunity in the United Kingdom. Candidate must reside in the UK and be work authorized. We are unable to offer visa sponsorship.

Candidate must reside within commuting distance to Mayfair, London.

Our corporate office in located in Chattanooga, Tennessee, (United States).

Benefits:

Transcard offers benefits starting the first of the month following the month of hire. Subject to further discussion and agreement the benefits will include Medical, Dental, Vision, Pension, Paid Time Off, Life-Disability Insurance, and more.

Please apply and see more job requisitions at:

https://www.transcard.com/careers

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

The Artificial Intelligence Product Manager at Transcard will be a catalyst driving the development and execution of AI powered products that enhance our payment solutions. This individual will create and execute the vision of embedded AI within our products. These solutions will deliver exceptional value to our customers and generate new revenue streams for Transcard. You will work closely with and lead engineering, data science, and business teams to define product vision, strategy, and roadmap, ensuring alignment with Transcard's broader goals and objectives.

Transcard is a rapidly growing Fintech, and this team is building out new AI technologies and innovations to greatly expand the capabilities and value of our platform. As the AI Product Manager, you will be an integral part of the development and deployment of our new AI-driven Virtual CFO capabilities embedded within our core payments platform. This is an exciting opportunity to help shape emerging technologies in the payments space.

· Define and articulate the product vision and strategy for AI and ML-driven solutions, ensuring alignment with Transcard’s business objectives and customer needs.

· Develop and maintain a product roadmap that prioritizes features and enhancements based on business impact, customer feedback, and market trends.

· Work closely with engineering, data science, and UX/UI teams to design, develop, and launch industry leading AI and ML products. Facilitate communication and collaboration to ensure successful product delivery.

· Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities, trends, and potential areas for innovation in AI and ML applications within the payments and fintech industry.

· Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and ensure the product exceeds user needs and expectations.

· Oversee the product development lifecycle, from ideation to launch, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within scope, and to the highest quality standards.

· Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement.

· Present product updates, insights, and recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders, effectively communicating complex concepts and strategies.

· Evangelize to prospects and clients Transcard’s AI vision and roadmap, highlighting how our AI driven insights and recommendations enable clients to automate complex workflows, uncover trends and opportunities in their data, and optimize clients’ working capital management.

· Continue to identify and evaluate emerging AI technologies and methodologies to maintain a competitive edge.

Requirements

· 7+ years of experience as a software product manager with at least 5 years at the intersection of IT/software product management and data science/analytics.

· 3+ years of proven experience as a Product Manager with a focus on AI/ML products, preferably in the fintech or payments industry.

· Deep understanding of financial obligations and decisions a CFO or Treasurer finds important to manage their business successfully.

· Strong understanding of business Accounts Payable (AP), Accounts Receivable (AR), Vendor Management, and Liquidity Management.

· In-depth experience with Gen AI and developing chat bot products.

· Proficiency in low-code and no-code tools and iterative prompts to refine outputs.

· Understand and develop Agentic AI frameworks, where large language models (LLMs) work together to complete tasks.

· Strong understanding of AI and ML technologies, including their applications and limitations.

· Experience working with data science teams and familiarity with AI/ML model lifecycle management.

· Proficiency in product management tools and methodologies.

· Guide a team of developers (preferably machine learning engineers) to develop and execute new data drive product strategies that align with business goals and drive customer value.

· Strong analytical abilities and experience with data-driven decision-making.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

· Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, with strong organizational and time-management skills.

· Collaborative and adaptable, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic and fun environment.

· Preferred experience in payments or financial services product management.

· Preferred knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance issues related to financial transactions.

· Experience with agile development methodologies.

Education and/or Certifications:

· Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business, or a related field.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be a complete list of duties performed.

No resumes from 3rd party vendors will be accepted at this time.

job_data.title: Data and AI Product Manager
job_data.description:
We know that people want great value combined with an excellent experience from a bank they can trust, so we launched our digital bank, Chase UK, to revolutionise mobile banking with seamless journeys that our customers love. We're already trusted by millions in the US and we're quickly catching up in the UK – but how we do things here is a little different. We're building the bank of the future from scratch, channelling our start-up mentality every step of the way – meaning you'll have the opportunity to make a real impact.

As a Product Manager at JPMorgan Chase within the International Consumer Bank, you will be a part of a flat-structure organization. Your responsibilities are to deliver end-to-end cutting-edge solutions in the form of cloud-native microservices architecture applications leveraging the latest technologies and the best industry practices. You are expected to be involved in the design and architecture of the solutions while also focusing on the entire SDLC lifecycle stages.

Our Data Tribe team is at the heart of this venture, focused on getting smart ideas into the hands of our customers. We're looking for people who have a curious mindset, thrive in collaborative squads, and are passionate about new technology. By their nature, our people are also solution-oriented, commercially savvy and have a head for fintech. We work in tribes and squads that focus on specific products and projects – and depending on your strengths and interests, you'll have the opportunity to move between them.

Job responsibilities:
• Develop and communicate a clear product vision and strategy for data and AI initiatives ICB. Align product goals with business objectives and market needs.
• Work closely with internal stakeholders, including business leaders, data scientists, engineers, and designers, to gather requirements, define product features, and ensure successful product delivery.
• Oversee the integration and release of data analytics and AI technologies into ICB products and services. Ensure that solutions are scalable, secure, and compliant with regulatory requirements.
• Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data and AI products. Use data-driven insights to make informed decisions and drive continuous improvement.

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills
• 6+ years of experience in product management with proven ability to lead and develop high performing product teams
• Excellent leadership and collaboration skills, with the ability to positively influence and inspire technology teams and stakeholders
• Strong track record of owning and developing a product domain strategy and roadmap. Able to balance short-term goals and long-term vision in highly complex environments
• Expertise on the AI and data product lifecycle, spanning from data discovery, data processing, model development, model deployment, and model monitoring
• Expertise in Cloud computing and architecture (e.g AWS)
• Hands-on experience building or using Data and AI (e.g LLM) solutions.
• Experience in any of Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), and Reinforcement learning with human feedback (RLHF), RAG, Search, and Agents.
• Familiarity with LLM frameworks such as LangChain, OpenLLM, and Llama Index
• Knowledge of operationalizing AI products responsibly through MLOps pipeline

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills
• Experience in Financial Services or other highly regulated industries
